title: WORST APP EVER!!
author: Oldboy1980
content: Does not work at all!!  Scheduled 3 appointments and it never showed up on my upcoming appointments tab.  This app worked great 1 year ago..  but now, it's a piece of crap! Worst part about it is, even if I try to go to the full site app on my phone, it still directs me to the mobile app!!  Ugh!!  I just want to set up a physical appointment for my son!!  Have been with sharp for 35 years now, but PLEASE!!  SOMEONE REVAMP THIS APP SO THAT IT ACTUALLY WORKS!!  so frustrating!!!!  ***********UPDATE************** Here are a few specific things that may help..  I never received an email confirming my scheduled appointment like a used to a year ago.. again, the appointments that I scheduled did not show up on my account under the upcoming appointments tab..  to the point where I thought I never even made the appointment.  Only to find out that I actually HAD scheduled 3 appointments upon contacting sharp by phone.  She was able to cancel the 2 that I didn't need but keep the 1 that I did.  Trying to sign in was a nightmare..  it constantly kept saying there was an error AND  it kept wanting me to agree to terms and conditions MULTIPLE times.

title: Not reliable
author: Josiah Sprague
content: I'd expect an app that people rely on for their health to have a higher standard of quality control and usability. I'd suggest that the team building this app invest time in increasing automated testing coverage, relax deadlines and pressure to release new features, and focus on paying off technical debt and refining usability and reliability of existing features for the next six months to a year. People use this app because their doctors ask them too, not because of shiny new features. To market this app to doctors, focus on the ease of use for patients to communicate with their doctors. At this point, I'd rather call my doctor than use this app. And I'm a tech savvy user. I doubt most of the older folks whose doctors use this app have the patience to make this app work for them.

content: First off, rating this app 5 stars just because you love your doctorâ€™s staff is the epitome of stupidity. Their staff has absolutely nothing to do with this app. This app actually has some potential - if the people who wrote it knew what they were doing: fâ€™rinstance, if youâ€™re on iOS 11, you have to go into Settings > General > Keyboard and shut off Smart Punctuation (this is what Healow Customer Support told me). In reality, you have to shut *everything* in Keyboard off if you want your message to your provider to go through; if any of the keyboard options are turned on, you get an error that states that â€œspecial characters such as â€˜ are not accepted.â€� Now who TH writes an app like that? Seriously? Also, the messaging section will not allow you to attach a file, such as a blood glucose report, in a .csv or .pdf file! How the H am I supposed to get my blood sugar report to my doctor without driving 20 miles to her office and using AirDrop directly to her phone? Really? Test results frequently do not appear. Two stars for its potential, and zero stars on execution and intentionally deleted functions equals One Star. I wish I could give it less.

name: healow
title: Horrible App
author: mcspaul
content: Everything within the app is horribly slow.  It frequently locks up while trying to load up the data from the section selected in the interface.  Their website seems to also suffer from this problem.  It is slow and pages lock up while loading data.  Messages from the doctor show up in small text at the bottom of the screen.  That is fine for short 1 sentence responses from the doctor but any longer message would be difficult to read.  Messages should be opened in a separate window, screen, or in some way separated from the rest of messages and also from the rest of the app.  What is the point of using an app instead of just a website/web portal if it does not take advantage of any of the hardware platform it is running on.  An example of this is the use of PIN codes for access.  Why not use the fingerprint reader (Touch ID on iOS) or facial recognition if the hardware supports it?  Scheduling an appointment is also much more difficult than it needs to be if your doctor is part of a large group.  When requesting an appointment it shows every doctor in the group not just your doctor.  That might not be so bad except that it only shows a small number of doctors at a time.  You then have to scroll down and let it load a small list of more doctors.  Having to constantly keep scrolling to the bottom, wait for it to load a small amount of doctors, and keep repeating this process until you find you doctor is slow and frankly irritating.  Also why are the doctors sorted alphabetically by first name.  Some doctors are referred to by their first name by patients but most are referred to by their last name.

The one other review posted (with 5 stars no less) has nothing do do with evaluating the app. It should be taken down. name: healow
title: One of THE Sorriest Apps Iâ€™ve Ever Used
author: gclunsf
content: Iâ€™m retired with about 40 years of computing experience and about 6-7 years of iPhone & iPad app user experience. I can tell you, up-front, this is one frustrating, poorly designed, sorriest excuse for an app Iâ€™ve had the misfortune to use to-date. Hereâ€™s the problems:  1) Constructing a new strong account password the app will accept should not be the â€œrocket scienceâ€� it seems to be. The password guidelines, some of which they supply on their web portal, are shown nowhere on the app screen where the new password has to be supplied. Showing ALL the guidelines is a common practice among most apps that handle input of of new passwords. Attempting to set a password for a new additional account under Healow seems next to impossible. It rejects them with a â€œNew Password is very weakâ€� message no matter how strong the password really is.  2) Once the user has started the process of adding a new account to Healow, ANY action by the user in navigating to another app before finishing the new account add  will result in the Healow app discarding ALL the information the user has input and take them back to a screen requesting their PIN code when going into settings. Why would a user navigate to another app while doing the new account add? I did it to refer to information needed for the new app addition process, such as the medical practiceâ€™s code and the userid and temporary password supplied by the medical organization, for example. I cannot say how absolutely frustrating and ridiculous this is and would be, especially, to inexperienced users. On this problem, alone, I give the app a â€œ1-starâ€� rating out of 5 stars. It shows exceedingly poor design and even poorer testing practices.  3) When adding an account by hitting the â€œ+â€� in the upper right corner of the My Accounts screen, a screen is brought up in which the user should be able to search by the provider name, practice name, or practice code. However, when that screen is brought up, the app often proceeds beyond it to a list of provider names & addresses as might be useful if the user wants to search by provider name. However, no provider name has been supplied. Getting the screen to stop and allow the user to instead provide a practice name or practice code, as is my case, depends on the user trying to tap the screen in several places across several iterations. Again, this is the result of exceedingly poor design and poorer testing practices.  4) Customer Support is nearly non-existent for this app. Iâ€™ve gone back and forth with these folks about 3 times to try to resolve the password problem. They finally said to just contact the medical provider whose account Iâ€™m trying to add, and theyâ€™ll work it with them. That medical provider isnâ€™t having the problem. I am. This demonstrates their unwillingness to work with their customers to fix problems.  Whatever you do, if you can, avoid this app like the plague!

author: Geevz

name: healow
title: Another so-so "one stop" portal solution
author: LucasHolt
content: The interface/UX is *fine*, nothing more. Healow gets the job done (for the most part) but leaves a lot to be desired, especially given every doctor/hospital/practice/insurance provider pushes a different "all-in-one" portal destination app and even makes it more difficult for those who don't opt in. Some are better, some are much worse but none are great or offer solutions that would inspire me to refer friends to use it. It seems these apps are just rushed to market in order to check a "product" box vs. solve problems/streamline patients' care.   Biggest issues so far:  â€¢ All the alerts informing me of my appointment a week ago. Thanks, but I remember because I was physically there. No need to send an 'alert' 5 days after the appointment, especially if there are no necessary next steps/key details recapped in the summary. Alerts are for new info, not  rehashing memories.  â€¢ Medical Docs: no feature to attach documents to messages within the portal... It's 2017, let's not reinvent the wheel in terms of basic communication needs. What's the point of if users have to use the portal only to then have to request email addresses from docs in order to (insecurely) transfer medical documents? This only adds extra steps and does nothing to expedite.  â€¢ Security: TouchID exists, please include it in your next update. Get up to speed or PLEASE just get out of the App Store. Why download a clunky app if it offers the same experience as a low budget web-site? â€¢ Messaging: the mobile app does not have a way to see sent messages or conversations in thread format. Instead you can only see messages you receive. As most users are not fluent in medical details, referencing back to earlier interactions/context from back and forth with medical staff is important.   PS: how does this app have 3.5 stars...?

Super simple to use, and gives my nutrition clients a way to update the basic info/picture in their chart, message me, and make appointments with me.

Additionally, it appears that if your doctor, pharmacy, et cetera, is not on their list of providers (and it seems a rather limited list) YOU CAN'T MANUALLY ENTER THE INFORMATION. What?? Are you kidding? This is supposed to be where I can store my personal health/medical information and I can only list a doctor if they have subscribed to the DrChrono service???? Who designed this app and what were they thinking???

Itâ€™s because I had a teledoc tell me within 10 seconds of talking to me (I purposely didnâ€™t say listening), telling me why itâ€™s viral. It was not. I immediately was given steroid shots, antibiotics and told never to use the service again. nothing I would say would let him hear me. Iâ€™ve dealt with colds, bugs, etc. Iâ€™m a mother. I know what they feel like in MY body. This was something that needed more care. I was in pain and this experience was more harmful than good. I also think doctors donâ€™t listen to womenâ€™s health concerns and always downplay it. I would love to see more training because the studies arenâ€™t good for womenâ€™s health.

title: A different experience
author: Teehuke
content: I am a Truck Driver. Specifically a Car Hauler and was experiencing severe discomfort from mouth sores. I had emptied out at a dealer near Raleigh, N C and was heading back to the Auto Rail Ramp in S C. I stopped at a Walmart and though it was after 7:00 pm the Pharmacy was still open. I asked the Pharmacist for a suggestion to reduce the discomfort. She replied that I likely had Thrush and that there was no over-the-counter remedy. It was now after 8:00 pm. What to do. My Wife and dispatcher suggested I take advantage of the Tele-Doc benefit provided by our company and as time was running out I did just that. I submitted a request per the steps outlined in the App and in a few minutes received a call from a Doctor who also agreed to the Thrush diagnosis. A short time later I was picking up not one but there scrips at the Walmart Pharmacy. The only cost to me being the usual co-pays for the meds. For those of us who travel far from home and Family Practitioner this is a real blessing. Thank you Dr. CarrğŸ’� -Bill W.

name: Teladoc
title: Great past experience
author: mankasboo
content: I used Teladoc back in 2012 or 2013 several times and they was great! I was signing up for some service I canâ€™t remember what it was exactly (it wasnâ€™t Teladoc but they was doing some kind of promotional work for Teladoc) but they offered Teladoc services as a additional opportunity to try out. (I believe this may have been when they was possibly still introducing Teladoc) I canâ€™t recall the specific reasoning for all the calls I placed to Teladoc but I do know one of them was for bronchitis that I typically get like clockwork twice a year. It took only minutes to get a call back once requested and the doctor was awesome, he listened to my symptoms and without me stating that I pretty much knew it was bronchitis he determined that it was most likely bronchitis and then proceeded to place me on antibiotics that I picked up within the hour at my pharmacy. It was such a relief for me considering I didnâ€™t have insurance and just waiting out my illness was total misery and my only other option at the time. I recall my other experiences being similar with no complications. I havenâ€™t used Teladoc for a few years now but because of lack of insurance again I decided that it would be my best route considering it would soon be the time of year that I do have one of my battles with bronchitis. I havenâ€™t like I said, used them in several years so I canâ€™t give a to date review and will have to give a follow up review when I do but I see a lot of reviews of unhappy customers complaining of paying fees just to be told to go to their primary physician to receive treatment for issues that the customers are sure what they are and that the Teladoc program claims they treat. I seriously hope that this isnâ€™t a issue because it would definitely be a deal breaker for me. The greatness of this service is being able to get prescription antibiotics the couple of times a year I may possibly need them without paying the high ER bill for a doctor to unnecessarily examine me for a illness I am already positive I have.  Only time will tell but I will definitely be doing a updated review once I have experienced how their service is now.

Iâ€™m sick and I thought I was at the end, but this friggin app said I scheduled a call for 8:45 and waited ti 9:11 to realize that there was more dialog at the very bottom of the page. name: Teladoc
title: A
author: hkayyford
content: I'd personally rate just the app itself as a solid 4 star creation. However, the medical expertise and care was highly lacking. It would be a shame to be charged $45 for information that, as a non-professional, I or anyone else could have provided, and which I did already employ. (As inadequate the medical information online can be, I can say Google more assistance than my "visit" today.   The doctor was somewhat congenial, and I think probably sincerely, but perhaps was also rushed. It wasn't evident to me he had any desire to stop to listen to what I had to say. I'd try to interject to address what the doctor was saying, but he continued to talk over me. He didn't use the video call option requested/that is supposed to be one of the main benefits of this technology.   Further, I worked in a pharmacy for quite some while, and an orthopaedic surgeon's practice after that, and know a good deal about doctors' needing to weigh the risks of their prescribing privileges, as well as how their advise affects themselves, their employer, and patient physiologically, ethically, and legally. The doctor wouldn't know any of this experience, nor that as someone who likes to be outdoors often, I stay updated on hazardous fauna and flora.    Considering the lack of discussion and regard or aid that the physicians bore, my evaluation of this medical means is resultantly lowered. And, with the knowledge of drug contraindications, but what appeared to be a lack of examining my medical history, the doctor might have seen my request wasn't out of line. "Ice it," soak it, keep it clean...not even basic first aid that most people are aware of were his repeated lines, and go to your local doctor if no improvement...suggests apathy from the doctor and, by association, the company. Perhaps it would be wise of Teledoc to re-examine it's processes or check its his busyness or limited time to talk.  I'll likely discuss these unfortunately unfavorable results with my husband about the possibility of refuting charges because this, sadly once more, required about/at least as much time as waiting in a care clinic would have and provider less benefit.  I'm not one who wants to take medications; I've got enough to deal with already. However, when I make a doctor's visit or, in this case, call, though not an emergency, it's typically because I have serious and substantiated reason to be concerned. Now, I'm more concerned to have been duped for my money, which should be a concern for Teladoc. Thank you doe you're time, Hannah

content: As another review states,  it seems good on the surface, but I don’t generally need help diagnosing my illness. The doctors generally don’t listen and want to argue with me about what’s happening when I already know and just need a prescription.  If you have absolutely no idea of you have the flu and need someone to tell you to go see your doctor or an urgent care, then Teledoc is for you. I know what is going on with my body and I need an appropriate prescription and here in lies the problem.  For example, I get bronchitis-like symptoms and have for years.  Years ago a primary care doc I had before he moved started me on an albuterol inhaler, mucinex and Z-pack when the symptoms reared up.  This has helped me get better every time and avoid bronchitis.  I get this a couple times a year and I have tried waiting it out on several occasions, but without the meds it has lasted 2 months, progressively getting worse until it turns into pneumonia.  So the way to fix it is with these three meds and it gets headed off before it gets real bad.   Getting the Z-pack is impossible because the docs tell me it won’t work.  Well I am 53 years old and heave been dealing with this for over 20 years and it DOES work.  What is the point of Teledoc if they refuse the simple prescription that will solve problem  in a couple days? I’m not looking for narcotics/pain meds, just an antibiotic....that works!  Now I get to go spend $160 at Urgent care.  Thanks for nothing Teledoc!

Charge you money, don’t deliver and can’t get any answers from customer service.  Don’t waste your time or money these losers and robbers.

content: I’ve used Teladoc three times now and I’ve always had a great experience with the doctors. I had to call customer service today because I couldn’t remember my password. Carrie went above and beyond to help me out. She was patient, polite, and knew exactly what to do to fix my problem. She even updated my health information for me so that I didn’t have to do it. I take a lot of medications and it’s hard to remember all of them. I kept forgetting the names of the meds I was taking, but Carrie was super sweet and didn’t make me feel bad about the situation. She made me feel appreciated, which was very nice considering a lot of customer service these days in general is subpar. Once I got off of the phone with Carrie, I literally got a call 30 seconds later from the doctor who took my case, Dr. Javvaji. She was also very kind and like-able. She gave me some extra tips to help me with my sinus infection, tips that I never would’ve even thought of on my own. She spoke to me like one of her own patients, which I really appreciated. She also knew exactly what to do to solve my health problems. Great service all around. Il definitely continue using Teladoc.

name: Teladoc
title: Beware in Georgia
author: SuperSlouch
content: What could have been. Beware using this service in Georgia.   I first contacted Teladoc last Thursday as I had been fighting some allergy and sinus issues for the three weeks prior.  Within 30 minutes of setting up an account I had a video visit with a doctor, a diagnosis of a sinus infection, and a 7-10 day cycle of antibiotics prescribed by the physician. I was told Georgia law only allowed the physician to prescribe three days worth of medication and I would need to call back for another refill.   So I finished my three day prescription on Monday and call Teladoc back to get a refill to keep my antibiotic cycle going. I was told by a rep that because I did not call within 72 hours that I would need another visit to get a refill. She made it clear I needed to call back the next time within the 72-hour window for refills. So, she schedules me a phone visit with another doctor who prescribes another three day supply and makes it clear to me I need to call within 72 hours to have my prescription refilled again to complete the cycle.   Thursday morning, within the 72 hour time window, I message Teladoc about a refill and am told I need to see a primary care physician. I call the number and speak with a representative and she tells me I did the right thing and someone from the Rx team would contact me to get the prescription refilled.   I get the call from a nurse, who transfers me to the Operations Manager, who then tells me that everyone I spoke to previously was wrong and that Teladoc can not refill the medication their doctors prescribed to me. After two visits, three people telling me to call within the 72 hour window, and two hours back and forth with representatives I am denied further care with the reason being everyone I had spoken to previously was incorrect. I explained again that I was given a 7 to 10 day treatment plan by Teladoc doctors but no help.   Needless to say, I cant schedule a visit with my PCP for over a month due to their backlog. I am feeling somewhat better but not 100% and Teladoc did not show they care about making sure I am well. The Operations Manager even agreed with me that I am on my own and out of luck.   In summary, avoid using this service in the state of Georgia. Teladoc staff do not know the rules and no matter how many times someone tells you to do something, there is a caveat to that; they will deny service and really act like they donâ€™t care about your health at all due to the laws regarding their practices in Georgia. It would be nice if they told me upfront and honest about what kind of service they can provide rather than keeping me on the hook only to dump me to the side when I was nearing conclusion of their prescribed diagnosis and treatment. Donâ€™t make the same mistake I did.

content: I used this for this first time this morning. I had an appointment with Dr. Younes at 8:45 EST. He told me that he was going to prescribe an antibiotic and send it to my local Walgreens. I called Walgreens a few hours later and they said they never received my prescription. I sent a message to the doctor as a follow up to the appointment. I called customer service and talked to someone about a quarter after 12. They said â€œsometimes the prescriptions get lost before theyâ€™re sentâ€�. She told me that she would have the prescription resent to the pharmacy. Well by 3pm, it still wasnâ€™t sent so I said to hell with it and went to an immediate health care center. Itâ€™s 4pm now and my prescription is being processed from the immediate care center; the prescription from Teladoc still hasnâ€™t been sent in.   When people are ill, they expect to receive medication in a timely matter to help prevent spreading bacteria and to ease pain. This does not seem like a priority to Teladoc. Iâ€™m very disappointed and would discourage anyone from using this service.

name: Teladoc
title: Rating ZERO (0) - Horrible Service!!! Waste of Time
author: KraziKeisha
content: Dr. On Demand is awesome.  I suggest everyone seek medical advise there.  Then there would be no need for Teladoc.   I was left on hold for 45 minutes.  No doctor ever spoke with me.  However, Teladoc took their co-pay.  I ended up paying completely out of pocket for my Dr. on Demand visit.    It was worth it.  I WILL NEVER use Teladoc again.

name: Teladoc
title: Best Service ever!
author: AKfambusyfam

name: Teladoc

name: Teladoc
title: Teledoc
author: Rutpat
content: The password reset process is awful I received 12 emails called 5 times held for way too long next day finally got a rep that got it done

name: Teladoc
title: Horrible!
author: nicole0317
content: The app is easy to use and the doctor was great, but whatâ€™s the point when they never send the prescription to the pharmacy?  $45 copay, 6 hours, and 2 phone calls to teledoc to get my prescription to the pharmacy and it STILL isnâ€™t there.   I ended up going to see my primary care physician in person and paying a $35 copay the same day.  Iâ€™m currently trying to get a refund from teledoc for the $45 I paid.  When I told the lady on the phone several hours later I wanted a refund and she said â€œyou pay when you talk to the doctor.â€� My response â€œI understand, but whatâ€™s the point of talking to a doctor if the medicine he prescribes you never gets to the pharmacy?â€�  This was my first experience with Teledoc and I donâ€™t plan to use it again unless they do some incredible service recovery.

name: Teladoc
title: Canâ€™t reset password
author: tuowls08
content: Useless. Iâ€™ve been trying to reset my password on both mobile and desktop and Iâ€™m unable to. When I make an attempt on mobile, I canâ€™t see the fields to update the password. When I try on desktop, I get an error message saying the link to reset my password has expired, immediately after retrieving the link! Useless.

name: Teladoc
title: Not worth it.  Save money/headaches and go to a clinic
author: Mike50401
content: Had the service, paid for the service and then today when I needed the service they said, it is cancelled.  They couldnâ€™t tell me why, only that it was canceled.    The only other time I used it I went to three pharmacies before I could find someone to accept the prescription.  Walgreens and the CVS across the street told me they donâ€™t take Teladoc prescriptions.  The one I did find said if they had known when it was transferred it was teladoc they wouldnâ€™t have taken it either.    All those fees and one time they are a pain to deal with getting prescriptions and the second time Iâ€™m canceled without any notification?  Save your money.

name: Teladoc
title: Fantastic
author: drlove89
content: This is great for working moms/parents itâ€™s hard to get time to take off and then drag your kid to an office with sick ppl! So thankful for this option of healthcare!

name: Teladoc

content: Worked great before the last update now is buggy and aggravating to use.

name: Teladoc

name: Teladoc

content: Would not allow me do upload pictures

name: Teladoc
title: Excellent service
author: Pattttio
content: Used Teladoc to times and have had great service.

name: Teladoc
title: Great Concept but, a lot of issues with the App and Database.
author: Gloer
content: I have not scheduled and, had a visit through this site as of yet. I set up my Teladoc account and the app this morning. There were multiple bugs with the application I downloaded from the App Store. In fact, I had to leave the app and login to the site via a browser to create a username and password, I can get the process started. There are very little instructions, as to The way your information needs to be submitted and, how it will be stored. Also, even though my daughter qualifies do to be covered under I have insurance, I can’t go back and look at her information because, she is an adult. Overall, I think it’s a great concept. However, I think the time and aggravation you may experience by not having to travel, wait for the doctor or commuters back home. I’m going to remain cautiously optimistic.

name: Teladoc
title: Jody
author: Jody K Bedwell
content: I used Teladoc today and after I signed up to be seen by a Dr? The app just sat there and never gave me any info re what would happen next. ie... please wait for the text message we will send you 2 minutes prior to your teladoc visit with the Dr. I guess they just expect the Patient to sit there and stare blankly at the phone or computer for however many hours it takes ???

name: Teladoc
title: Can’t even finish setup
author: rappersmom
content: I used Teladoc on my computer and decided to download the app. Every time I try to set it up, it says it needs to send me an email with a code. I don’t ever receive the email and subsequently get logged out for inactivity.

name: Teladoc
title: Terrible First (And Last) Experience
author: Zasatko
content: Heard good things about this from other coworkers. Decided to give it a try when I had an immediate need for care (non-emergency). Thought this would be an easy way to connect with a doctor quick instead of maybe having to wait a day to get in to an actual doctors office. Submitted my request and waited around the house for an hour or two..no response. Went about my day. After 6 hours passed, still no call or message, I contacted customer support for a refund. I get things happen, but for touting a service that hinges on quick response it was a fail. I’d give it one star if it weren’t for the good customer service I received and actually quickly receiving the refund. Won’t be trying this again, will take my chances at the normal doctors office.

name: Teladoc
title: Drag their feet
author: Eadszie
content: Been waiting 8 hrs for my prescription to get sent to the pharmacy. Keep calling them and they say they’re backed up. Should have just went to urgent care

name: Teladoc
title: Problems from the start
author: menmaddie
content: Dr was friendly and knowledgeable. Prescription ordered. Pharmacy claims they never received it. Teledoc takes 48 hours to respond to problems like transmissions problems. When the simple fix is call thit pharmacy directly smh. Total waste of my day. Company is definitely wasting money on this supposed benefit for its employees.

name: Teladoc
title: I'm rating the App not the Teladoc service
author: Smitchak
content: So my experience with the actual Teladoc service was great!! But the app & the website both need some simple improvements. I have a pet peeve when I'm asked to create a username and password and there's no guidance whatsoever, like "Don't use your email address for the username" so I create a username only to be dismissed with a "No special characters" error message. After getting through the username gauntlet, I got an error message on my password where I was finally told it had to be at least 10 characters. A simple text box on the webpage or app would be helpful. Just sayin'. The cherry on top? When I was prompted to enter my health card number, which ends in -01. Yup, you guessed it. No special characters allowed.

name: Teladoc
title: Pam
author: Yoitrr t
content: This will be my first time to use app. Enrolled and waiting for my call

name: Teladoc

content: This service has been a great alternative to having to visit a brick and mortar clinic.

name: Teladoc
title: Poor service
author: Tubucalefaso67

name: Teladoc

name: Teladoc
title: Great in theory
author: lomjs
content: Paid $10 for a doctor to tell me she could help me over the phone. What is the point?

name: Teladoc

content: Much better than driving to an urgent care to see a doctor. Just takes mins and I don’t have to leave work

name: Teladoc
title: On a Sunday!
author: rk82128
content: My son, for the last couple of days has been very congested, coughing and now said his ear hurts. With everything closed on Sunday, being able to turn to Teledoc is awesome!!!

name: Teladoc
title: WASTE OF MONEY
author: tcmsbabi
content: Both times that I’ve called it’s a complete waste of money. They do NOTHING!!

name: Teladoc
title: Easy
author: Pittguy.
content: Loaded the app . Easy to use. It really helps when your traveling

name: Teladoc
title: I love this service!!
author: Queen SheShe
content: I have always wished for an app of service like this. I highly recommend this app for basic illnesses that aren’t life threatening. I get a RX sent to my pharmacy and if need be a doctors note sent to me. It’s truly a time saver and is soo convenient to use. I mean really... I had the stomach flu.. requested an appointment and within minutes I had meds sent for nausea to my pharmacy. No one wants to sit in a doctors office when they are throwing up with a stomach bug just to get anti nausea meds. Meanwhile infecting everyone you come into contact with. This service is truly amazing.

name: Teladoc
title: Terika hung up on me
author: MattDavidT
content: Customer service provider Terika hung up on me, after refusing to transfer me to a supervisor after more than an hour wait for a visit for my three year old son.  After another hour waiting, Jason called me and although he was apologetic was also not able to help - though he did offer to switch me from video consultation to phone consultation. Unfortunately for me, that involved starting the wait all over again from the back of the line and losing the two hours of waiting already underway.   Eventually I received a phone call but by then I had already sought additional care at a local urgent care.   If you care about someone, if you love them, if you want them to receive competent care in a timely fashion - avoid this service.

name: Teladoc
title: Love it
author: Marizta
content: Me gusta pues puedo recibir ayuda médica profesional en mi casa

name: Teladoc
title: Rude, condescending and unprofessional
author: Fio613
content: Horrible experience with the physicians from this service, in particular Dr. Stephen Southard.  I had a horrible experience with this physician. Not only was he completely incompetent and unhelpful (didn’t ask a single question about my symptoms, medical history, medications), but he was highly rude and condescending and proceeded to shame me for a condition that was embarrassing enough to talk about to begin with. Highly unprofessional.   Submitted another request, and it was closed moments later saying they could never reach me (he didn’t even attempt to call).  Will be asking our HR department to consider some of your competitors.

name: Teladoc
title: Services
author: Timelesssoul1
content: Doctor told me there was nothing he could do.

name: Teladoc

I was on the phone for over 20 minutes while they tried to find my information and account.  None of my account information was populating and I was offered an option to reset my account and to pay a $45 copay vs my usual $10 copay (not the customer service tech’s fault). This service based on convenience is not so convenient.

name: Teladoc
title: Quick response
author: Gailingeorgia
content: Last week I was feeling horrible. I called and was receiving a doctor’s call, before I even hung up with Teladoc!  Great response time. No hassle!

name: Teladoc

author: jgphone

name: Teladoc
title: Horrible app! Waste of money!
author: heff24
content: Today was the first time I used this app and it will be the last, the doctor was EXTREMELY RUDE! He was rushing and didn’t even seem to care. He didn’t give any medicine and told me that if I was worse the next day to see my local doctor.

name: Teladoc

content: Everything else about the app is good

name: Teladoc

name: Teladoc

name: Teladoc

name: Teladoc
title: J Hocker
author: tjhocker
content: If u have a cold, I’m sure they’re fine. Dr Haseem was worthless.

name: Teladoc
title: Glad to have an expert today listen
author: Bretwvu
content: Twice in a week we have called for our 6 year old.  Both times we were there led to take her to physician.  It’s nice that we get an experienced doctor to guide us through.

name: Teladoc
title: Great service
author: merlyne7858
content: Speedy service great staff

name: Teladoc
title: Wonderful service
author: impressed in SC
content: Within 4 mins a doctor called me and was very knowledgeable about my situation. All he needed to do was call in a prescription to my pharmacy and we were done. Painless. And copay-less!

name: Teladoc
title: Convenient idea. Terrible software.
author: Garrett Dimon
content: It can be somewhat handy, but in my experience, it requires a lot of fighting with the software to get it to work, and the instructional content is often wrong or unhelpful.

name: Teladoc
title: A doctor within seconds
author: Dezormo
content: My primary doctor couldn’t get me in with in the next couple days so I decided to try Teladoc. I cannot believe how fast and efficient it was. It was about a 15 minute phone call to give them my personal information and then the doctor called me back within seconds. After a five-minute phone conversation with the doctor, I had a prescription waiting for me 15 minutes down the road.

name: Teladoc
title: Good experience
author: Carterboysmomma
content: I've had nothing but good experiences. It's part of our plan in my husbands insurance policy thru work so it's free for us to use. The longest time I've waited for a call back is 30 mins. Its usually five minutes seriously. The doctors are always very professional, I don't call or go in unless it's absolutely necessary. My family has had a lot of minor health issues for years. A lot is seasonal sinus infections. About 2 good ones a year. I try OTC meds for a good week before I call. I've always gotten antibiotics when warranted. Ive called with UTI, which I've suffered with for years. I always buy the OTC test strips and test prior to calling once again always have gotten antibiotics for it. I don't have anything bad to say. You can also take photos and upload as well of your calling about a rash of topical infection.

name: Teladoc
title: Awful
author: dobo1925
content: This software is full of bugs that freeze the app. Terrible design

name: Teladoc
title: Avoid Saturday fees!
author: msjaymi333
content: First time using this app through my company and it was a breeze, best of all I avoided an expensive hospital copay, waiting for hours, a copay from my regular doctor and I did it all from my couch.

name: Teladoc
title: App made Easy
author: Marcusarillious
content: I tried to set up an appointment on my phone on their website and it was a lot harder. The app made it easy.

name: Teladoc
title: Great service

name: Teladoc

name: Teladoc

name: Teladoc

The doctors have always been extremely professional and caring to whatever health issues were at hand. I would be lost without this benefit!

name: Teladoc
title: Dumb timing for review request
author: SouthFresh
content: You set up the app to request a review before a single transaction could take place. Instant 1 Star

name: Teladoc
title: Frustrated - App keeps crashing
author: TamTram72
content: The app keeps crashing. I’ve uninstalled twice and reinstalled and will work for a bit then crashes half way through the setup process. Very frustrating.

name: Teladoc
title: App crashes constantly
author: mcstarr
content: App crashes as soon as you open it.

name: Teladoc
title: App crash
author: Austen
content: Why does this app keep crashing?

name: Teladoc
title: What a waste of time and money
author: Patmo2387
content: I explained to the doctor my symptoms.  It was obvious I had strep throat. I've had it before so I knew that's what I had. He insisted that he could not prescribe me antiobiotics. He said that I must see another doctor and get swabbed.  So here I am paying another doctor for something I knew I had . I was diagnosed with strep throat.  Thanks teledoc for taking my money.

name: Teladoc
title: Awesome
author: Hatley Girls
content: It’s so convenient. I’ve used it several times for my daughter and it was so much better than a ready clinic.

name: Teladoc
title: So convenient!
author: Ang oh
content: I have never had a bad experience with Teladoc. The doctors are thorough and helpful. This is so much better than taking a sick child to the ER and risk catching further illnesses. We love Teladoc!

name: Teladoc
title: Problems with app
author: Choppas80
content: Overall, the app is ok but it does have a few drawbacks. For one, you can schedule an appointment but you cannot reschedule or cancel an appointment via the app. When you want to reschedule or cancel, you have to call in to the Teledoc company. Even then, you either have to wait on the phone for a representative, that ends up having you call somewhere else to get the help you need. In the end, you have to leave a message for someone. Teledoc advertises that it is available 24/7-365, so I can’t understand why you would have to leave a voicemail?! The only positive is that it can occasionally be quicker than getting in to see a doctor. Although, you personal doctor knows you better and is more apt to treat you and your symptoms better.

name: Teladoc
title: I’m pregnant
author: crazy prego lady
content: I’m pregnant I would like to go see someone in person rather then over my phone and I can’t find a list of places to go because I can only contact someone on my phone and I have to pay 10$ just to find if there’s a Obgyn around me to help with me and the baby

name: Teladoc
title: Keeps crashing
author: w.w.e.
content: Every time I open the app it crashes after a few seconds. Deleted and downloaded again but it keeps happening.

name: Teladoc
title: Visit
author: bnorii
content: Doctor would not give me a prescription. He said I needed to see a dermatologist for more testing. Said the nurse would give me a referral. When I did not get the referral I asked and was told it’s against their policy to give referrals. What is the point of wasting time and money if they are going to do ZERO to help you. I will be deleting this crap app.

name: Teladoc
title: Incredibly helpful
author: Emmmmmily❤❤❤
content: Every time I have used this app it has helped me SO MUCH. I get migraines quite often and they have prescribed me the same meds I would receive at the ER. So easy, and much quicker then the ER and Urgent Care. Thank you, Teladoc!

name: Teladoc
title: Crashing
author: Vikingqb7
content: App keeps crashing

name: Teladoc
title: App keeps crashing
author: Bwall4735
content: App keeps crashing, tried uninstalling and reinstalling without improvement.  Have an iPhone C running iOS 11.4.1.

name: Teladoc
title: Right place.  Right time.
author: A Sarge
content: I love this service.

name: Teladoc
title: Time zone issues
author: Brf7
content: The app has time zone issues. I live in Arizona which floats between Pacific and mountain standard time. The app scheduled an appointment in Mountain standard time when Arizona is currently in Pacific time which screwed everyone up. The app needs to be fixed to correctly recognize where a person is located and what time zone they are currently in.

name: Teladoc
title: Login troubles
author: Just*B
content: I can’t login successfully. I have my username and password written down and everytime it suggests I’m wrong and instructs me to call. I spend 20 minutes going over my address and security questions, I’ve changed my password so many times?! Drives me insane.

name: Teladoc
title: $45 for nothing
author: August "Spud" West
content: This was a waste of time and money.   Doctor hardly asked any differential questions at all. Recommended the most basic interventions possible.   Cordial, but worthless.

name: Teladoc
title: Waste of time
author: Milo 541
content: Doctors don’t call at schedules times.  One doc simply did not call call for 30 minutes - no explanation or message was offered.  Customer support is horrible - they don’t answer the phone.  Unnecessary limits on what Teledoc DRs are allowed to treat and prescribe.  The app itself is clunky with overly heavy handed security.   I tried Teledoc because my local doctors office is a bureaucratic mess, unfortunately Teledoc has many of the same problems.

name: Teladoc
title: Very Valuable Service !  :-)
author: Frank - Tennessee USA
content: Thank you TELADOC for being here, available to me and others. Your service is great, easy, quality. I don’t need medical care often st all, but always TELADOC makes it possible for me to get the care I need, when, and where I need it, rather than go without for days or weeks without. I travel often, so medical care is difficult to access since a “new patient” wherever I go when away from home, but with TELADOC, I am always going to a familiar medical provider of mine. Thanks TELADOC!

name: Teladoc
title: Great!
author: NeenaMary
content: I have used Teladoc several times and have  always had great service from them with  very understanding doctors.

name: Teladoc
title: Takes too little by to set up
author: aa7246
content: I tried to be prepared to use this app by entering all information as soon as I registered but I wasn’t prompted to enter medical history until my child was actually sick and I needed to use the service. It was beyond stressful to track down all of his medications and dosages and doctor visits while we were dealing with a sick child. This should have been part of the initial setup or we should have the option to skip. I nearly gave up and went to a clinic rather than try to get past the medical history pages. Very frustrating

name: Teladoc
title: So helpful
author: pedserrn123
content: Wonderful way to get fast speeding care.

name: Teladoc
title: Unresponsive
author: goose0673
content: If you like automated messages this apps for you.  If you want to talk to a doc, not so much.  Didn’t need BP treatment before but since dealing with this I might.

name: Teladoc
title: Great
author: mlcorrales
content: Fast, easy & painless right in the privacy of my bedroom!

name: Teladoc
title: Not worth the trouble
author: bbbmom5
content: I setup my account 2 days ago and was able to speak with a doctor very quickly. This part worked great!  I had side effects from the prescription the doctor prescribed so I went back into the Teledoc app to speak to another doctor and I was not able to continue because the app could not verify my medical records. They verified them 2 days ago!  I don’t understand why it worked 2 days ago but not today.  I called customer service and they said I needed to setup a temp account and start my medical history all over again!  This took 30 minutes to set up last time. I decided it would be faster to go to urgent care. I do not recommend this service.  It’s not as easy as it sounds.

name: Teladoc
title: Need the app to communicate with mobile
author: Unkle Monky
content: I tried using the browser first and the video was not supported on my iPad. Once I set up my acct and got signed into the app I was already in the que from trying in the browser.   I saw a Family Medicine Doctor Cole. I shared a photo of a rash. He sent an RX to my pharmacy to treat symptoms. He advised me if it returns then I’ll need to see my pcp to discuss managing it as a chronic condition.   So very easy, inexpensive and as good as face to face visit.

name: Teladoc
title: Worthlesss company
author: The Web King 11
content: Worse than the rest of the healthcare system which is saying a lot.  Don’t waste your time. It takes forever to set up and they almost always need you to call someone. You can’t just do anything through the app.  Then, you wait 45 minutes and no docs answer. Just ignore this company and you’ll be in better health.

name: Teladoc
title: Very simple
author: mark elCapitan
content: It’s very user friendly. Thanks for making this simple.

name: Teladoc
title: Initial experience
author: Eat2Enjoy
content: My first experience with a doctor using this app was terrible. At this time, I would not recommend using this service.

name: Teladoc
title: Very Satisfied aside from one “Bad-Egg” Doc
author: rkdr4
content: This service has been such a convenience for my family. With a young baby, it has been so nice to be able to use Teledoc as opposed to packing a baby with us to our own doctor’s appointments. We have also used Teledoc on weekends when our doctor’s office was not open and while on vacation in another state- each time free of charge, amazing!! Our only issue was getting a doctor once whose lack of listening and problem-identification skills meant we had to advocate strongly for ourselves in order to get appropriate care. This seems to have been a fluke, however, and without this encounter, we would have given Teledoc 5 stars.

name: Teladoc
title: Easy to navigate but...
author: gemd65
content: Was unable to upload my photo or take a photo. I would get a white screen every single time. I have an iPhone 6plus?

name: Teladoc
title: Do Not Use
author: Ozstl
content: Do not use this service unless you aren’t sick.  My insurance provider was pushing it so we signed up.   We were traveling and my son had a clear sinus infection struggling with it for sever days. After taking our payment (they have that part down) the Dr or whatever she was told him to see if it get’s better in a few days and if not see a Dr.    They ask almost no questions and wanted to get off the phone fast.  Seriously they charged us for this.    Worst part is when we called to complain they said.  Oh, well have to call you back.   Horrible service.

name: Teladoc
title: Amazed!
author: Hollisua
content: I just used Teladoc for the first time and I am truly amazed! The sign up process was seamless and the app is super easy to navigate. A doctor called me less than a minute after I filled out my appointment request and he was very nice and understanding. I would highly recommend this service to a friend or colleague but I am sorry to hear other people had bad experiences.

name: Teladoc
title: Great Call
author: ljfzlutsljgzljfzjfz
content: The doc was wonderful - great advice on mental health issues

name: Teladoc
title: So so
author: mom2*3
content: I love convenience… I just wished I could understand what the doctor says! I’m not sure how many doctors there are, but these last 3 to 4 times I’ve called I have gotten a doctor with a very strong accent that I can’t understand.

name: Teladoc
title: 1st Time user
author: Goobly doobly
content: Things went real smooth with setting up a request

name: Teladoc
title: Saves me time, stress, & money
author: ladcraig
content: Today, I spoke to a dr about my allergies. I saw an allergist last year, know what helps me, and was able to video chat with the dr and have my prescriptions filled in the time it would have taken me drive to my primary care dr. Love the convenience and security of knowing I have a dr on call if/when needed.

name: Teladoc
title: Quick and easy
author: Donkey1818
content: The title says it all

name: Teladoc
title: Amazing!
author: Toomeykids
content: We have used TelADoc for a few months and we love it!!

name: Teladoc
title: GREAT!!!
author: OMINIKKI
content: My family has used Teledoc five times and we love the service. Saves us time waiting at urgent care or making an appointment, gas, and energy you don’t have when you’re sick.

name: Teladoc
title: First Visit Was a Pleasant Experience
author: OCTraveller
content: The Doctor assigned to me was professional and helpful. I knew I had an UTI because I had many times before. Told the Dr my symptoms and results of an in home test and prescription was on its way. Pharmacy called 10 min later to say it was ready.  My alternative was the urgent care at twice the cost and 10 times the wait. It was a Sunday.  I would not hesitate to use again.

name: Teladoc
title: Professional and convenient
author: Psalms 100
content: Thank you for prompt and friendly service.

name: Teladoc
title: A fabulous app
author: Amazing Grace Interiors
content: This is a phenomenal service.  Especially on weekends when your primary care physicians office is closed.  Urgent Care and emergency room visits are costly.

name: Teladoc
title: Best in the world
author: Michellelo67
content: I love Teladoc it saves me money and time in emergency’s!!!

name: Teladoc
title: Easy registration and appointment setting
author: $moki
content: Before treatment, this completely blows away the experience of waiting in urgent care!

name: Teladoc
title: I love teledoc
author: Dacon
content: Many a time it was there when I just couldn’t get to dr. There always there ... love love love it

name: Teladoc
title: Convenient
author: ScootahGee
content: This is the best for sinus infections and slight discomforts!

name: Teladoc
title: Love this app
author: meoooooowz
content: So convenient and from my experience with the professionals so far, they’ve always been very caring.

name: Teladoc
title: A++++
author: MaalWells
content: Nothing is better than being able to speak to a doc while in bed. Doctors are prompt and professional. I recommend to everyone!

name: Teladoc
title: Service is getting better!
author: Carol DC
content: Been using Teladoc for almost a year now.  Initially had horrible experiences but this app has helped me a few times recently, so I am now trying it more often.  I wish that the responses from dermatologists were quicker but they’ve been helpful once they’ve answered.  Hope the app and company continues to improve their service.

name: Teladoc
title: It NOT worth your time!
author: Mystikah
content: Quick to charge Our credit card but wouldn’t offer any solution! I am so depressed the Dr. told ME to go somewhere else! Nah, that so rude to tell a patient to “Go somewhere else “. I am asking for help and I got turn away smh. Wow! I can’t stop crying I’m out of meds and I can’t get in to see My primary Dr til August!!! So in the meantime I am gonna have bad thoughts racing! If your looking for a Dr. run the other way as fast as you can! They only want to charge your credit card!!! Never again! I think half the people who gave good scores are probably the employees and Drs! Giving themselves praise! BS!

name: Teladoc
title: Not impressed
author: Nicole's Ipod video
content: I had a painful knot on my head show up and I was worried it was the result of a spider bite. I requested a visit ASAP. 3 hours later.... I’ve now had two doctors reviewing my file and my request has all of a sudden disappeared from my file. Looks like I’ll be using my primary physician from now on.

name: Teladoc
title: It’s good I guess
author: BrookebPaige
content: The photos don’t load in the app. The wait times are always a long time, even with a scheduled one, you’re looking at like a hour wait after. The support team is helpful but the customer support thing takes hours too.

name: Teladoc
title: Great first experience
author: LAwoman91766
content: I needed a refill on my meds and no time to make it into the drs office. This was sooo easy and all done within 5 minutes.  Love this service.

name: Teladoc
title: Very disappointing
author: blazeshell
content: I thought this was going to be great tool to have for medical care. It took a long time to set it up with someone on the phone, so I decided to upload my profile through the app. That didn’t take as long. Once I finished setting up my profile I needed to have a video chat for my daughter. I waited 2 hours to only receive a call asking if I could switch my apt to a phone call. At this point I just wanted to talk to a doctor. So I agreed. The lady ran a “test” call to make sure the phone call would come through and it did. Great I’m thinking, I will finally be able to talk to someone. I waited for another hour and as I’m waiting I’m getting notices that doctors are reviewing my profile.   I’m getting no phone calls no notifications that someone is trying to contact me. I check the app and then I check my email. Sure enough I get an email saying my apt has been cancelled. That a doctor had tried to contact me 3 times. Now that I’ve  been waiting for almost 3 hours I am really annoyed and upset for waisting so much time. I call again and talked to someone to figure out what happened. Why I didn’t receive a phone call. He said it showed that there was an attempt by a doctor to contact me. I let him know we did a test call and that came through. I checked my phone to make sure i didn’t miss any call and the last call that showed was from the “test” call.  So ultimately this is not a great option for getting medical attention. I had high hopes that this would be easy, but save your time and energy and call your physician office instead!

name: Teladoc
title: Don’t bother me with your review bs
author: Rich(8/85296/96/&)/
content: I give every requested review a negative one. Tired of this BS.

name: Teladoc
title: Wait time
author: CMM987
content: Called on a Saturday night. Had to wait over an hour just for them to call and tell me that the wait would be so long they couldn’t give me time that a doctor would be able to call. Of course, this was after they took my money.

name: Teladoc
title: Impossible to get help
author: racing_Girl 14
content: The only time I got a doctor, they said my issue is cause I’m fat. Next time I tried, scheduled a visit and got no call even an hour after the scheduled time (and ten minute text warning) and their 1-800 support couldn’t figure out why or get ahold of anyone to tell me why. Never talked to anyone that day. Desperate now for a doctor and have to work 10 hour days the next three days, did the ASAP visit... guess within a few minutes means within an hour. Does anyone ever actually call or do they just get your hopes for help up?

name: Teladoc
title: Total Ripoff
author: Tedster 1234554321
content: Used Teladoc for a dermatologist recommendation for Acutane. Read the terms and conditions, nothing said anything about Acutane specifically, so I went through with the meeting, $75. The Doctor couldn’t prescribe me anything and just basically agreed with me that it would be a good idea to get on Acutane. I ALREADY KNEW THAT! I DID NOT NEED TO PAY TELADOC $75 FOR THEM TO TELL ME THAT! Submitted a request for a refund and was denied. Do yourself a favor and just see a real Doctor!

name: Teladoc
title: Pic sharing
author: FIREn19
content: I tried to set an appointment with pics of poison ivy rash. App froze up. Grrrrrrr. So had to shut phone off and restart. Skipped the pics and is now a general medical consult

name: Teladoc
title: Life saver!
author: Billduenow
content: I love Teladoc! They have been there ALWAYS at anytime. They have meet my family medical needs and SAVE me a ton of money! Thank you!

name: Teladoc
title: It deserves zero stars
author: Consumer19
content: More than an hour trying to log in. Finally worked then spent another 20 minutes completing questionnaire only to be kicked off.   Finally logged in on the website and requested an appt for times offered. Provider declined and suggested a time that I specifically noted I was not available. No way to cancel online or in the app, you have to call and listen to their inane voice prompts and wait on hold. First attempt will be the last. Bye.

name: Teladoc
title: Easy
author: Deano0077
content: This is a great way to make a doctor visit.

name: Teladoc
title: Logging in is a pain!!!
author: SpaGirl321
content: All you’re doing when you log in is requesting a call. You answer security questions & if you can’t remember your password, you’re screwed. I thought this was supposed to be for convenience, but every time I use it, it is very INconvenient !

name: Teladoc
title: I am so grateful for Teldoc
author: Grateful and feeling better
content: I had a roaring UTI. I was in so much discomfort. It was part of a holiday weekend and the Doctor’s office was closed. I requested a call from Teldoc and they called within minutes. She called my local pharmacy right after we hung up the phones. I had my medicine within 20 minutes. Teldoc was so worth it.

name: Teladoc
title: Ear infection
author: Msfyrkat
content: Had an ear infection for a week. Was told to go to the emergency room. No script nothing! What’s the point of using this? I can get better advise going on the internet and it’s free. I would give it zero stars for its webmd advice.

name: Teladoc
title: Great Service
author: D_gonzales
content: I’ve used Teladoc for about 1-2 years and received relatively good care. The reasons I’m giving it 5 stars is because 8 out of 10 times I’ve received good care from the doctors. They are very helpful and knowledgeable about whatever I’m going through and they listen to what I tell them. I generally know what’s going on with me and they do a great job of listening to me and my concerns, and putting me at ease.

name: Teladoc
title: Convenient!!!
author: Starlaparrott
content: I love this app - I can take it anywhere and it has come in handy for my family and myself several times!! I love that I don't have to leave where I am to talk to a doctor.

name: Teladoc
title: Bell
author: Nickey Bell
content: No need is using this. Just make an appointment with your regular doctor or go to urgent care if your a fan!!!!! This would be a total waste of your money and time!

name: Teladoc
title: READ THE REVIEWS.. It’s waste of money
author: Maannj
content: I was fooled by the 4.8 stars rating, don’t do the same mistake and read the reviews yourself before you waste your money. You will see hundreds similar stories, none of them are happy. If you need real care GO SEE A DOCTOR who can actually prescribe a treatment. This is NOT the same. Now my story is below  The doctor recommended me a medication then literally asked me to go see a doctor to get the prescription because Teladoc doesn’t allow them to prescribe it. They actually charged me the full specialist fees like exactly what you would pay to see specialist doctor. And now I have to visit another real doctor physically and pay the same amount I just paid to get the prescription. The irony? Teladoc FAQ web page clearly states the doctor is allowed to prescribe it. So I was tricked into believing I’m going to see real doctor. It’s either the doctor lied or Teladoc lied in their FAQ and they do indeed disallow prescription? I don’t know but I know for sure if I visited real doctor from the beginning I would’ve gotten the better treatment at cheaper cost

name: Teladoc
title: Horrible! Totally unprofessional
author: AR0780
content: The first provider I attempted to use rescheduled me TWICE for our initial appointment with no explanation, the first time 15 mins after our appt was supposed to start, and the second time about 15 mins prior.  then when I proposed times for yet a third initial appointment and asked her to please be professional and honor the next appointment we make, I never heard back from her again. Um, is this medical practice or Tinder..?  I know it’s a half-price doc, but seriously?  We live in a small town with few medical options, so I’m trying again with a different Teledoc provider and hoping for the best.

name: Teladoc
title: Love Teladoc
author: Kimberly_quilts
content: I’m so happy our insurance offers Teladoc to us as part of our plan.   Being able to do a simple visit from where ever we are is perfect. The convenience of the service is my favorite part, but I also love the quick care they provide.   I have used the service many times for all family members for a variety of reasons and was satisfied with each consult.   The physicians are very caring and take time to really understand what you are calling for.  The option to add photos is great.   I recommend Teladoc to everyone.

name: Teladoc
title: Great idea poorly implemented
author: twinkletwinkletoes
content: The UI is terrible and I hope you never need to call customer service as no one is available and if they are they probably can’t help you.

name: Teladoc
title: Love this Option
author: The Marsh Family
content: I am so glad that my insurance gives us Teledoc as part of our plan!!

name: Teladoc
title: It could be better
author: Teonsellsjax
content: App crashes A LOT. In turn you restart too many times for one appointment.

name: Teladoc
title: Incredible Convenience
author: Sachelle777
content: As a busy mother other of two appreciate this being part of our plan to seek medical attention as quickly as possible when primary care may be all booked and being able to be proactive about their health needs and combat issues quickly!

name: Teladoc
title: Amazing and so helpful! Thank you!
author: linds rar
content: Kartik K. Patel, MD conducted my phone consultation just now for an unexpected sinus infection I’ve acquired while traveling for my job. His assessment was thorough and convenient. This is one of the best advances in apps and technology related to medicine in my opinion. He was extremely nice and helpful. He called in an antibiotic for me immediately. I am so grateful for this service. Thank you Dr. Patel and Teledoc. I wish I could give this 50 stars!

name: Teladoc
title: First time user
author: Thomas6606
content: Filling out your admittance was almost as bad as going to the local docs.  Hopefully now that it is done the rest will be more useful.  If it is I’ll upgrade this review.

name: Teladoc
title: Wasted time...
author: Mandy's 5S
content: In the beginning, Teladoc was good but as of late, it’s a big waste of time. Barely understand what’s being said because of the thick accents...lots of repeating on both ends. When you are lucky enough to get your issue somewhat understood, they just recommend you go to dr/urgent care/ER. Just cut out the middle man. :(

name: Teladoc
title: Absolutely Awesome!!!
author: #1 dudes
content: Could not have asked for a better service. Phone rang with in under a minute. Dr. was very kind and courteous. Called in a prescription for a simple problem within 10 minutes. Two days later the problem was seeming resistant so I went on Teladoc to ask a nurse how long I should wait to notice a difference on the antibiotics. They called me very quickly and had already spoken to the doctor. Was going to call in a new script for me but it was one that I recognized as making me sick in the past so they got hold of the doctor again and then called me back with another new prescription. called in another script to my pharmacy right away. It cost me $45 total. That was my fee for the initial transaction. Could not ask for more. I would highly recommend this to anyone. Cost me at least half of what it would have at my doctors office and I have insurance.

name: Teladoc
title: Eye infection
author: Gene 18
content: This was a awful and useless visit. MD charged and referred me to primary care for a stye on my eyelid that became infected. I sent a picture and described my symptoms. What a waste and useless benefit my employer has provided for me! A antibiotic eye drop could have been ordered. I don’t think I’ll ever use Teledoc again!

name: Teladoc
title: Best Service
author: ProVerizon
content: This app is awesome especially when your sick and don’t want to leave your house and spread your germs about

name: Teladoc
title: Can’t upload photos
author: Creative Flute
content: Great idea, fine app. But the app crashes when you want to upload photos to add to your appointment. Tried it 3 times. :(

name: Teladoc
title: Worst experience ever
author: allied5631
content: I put in for a dermatology appointment for a severe allergic reaction. The app said someone would be in touch within 48 hours. Seemed long but I was willing to wait to have a real dermatologist give me a consult. I kept checking the app for when my appointment would occur. Today — it was all gone as if I’d never requested it. I called customer service and was told they did not have a dermatologist available so they cancelled it. What I don’t understand is why it took them over 24 hours to figure out they did not have someone and also why NOONE MESSAGED OR TOLD ME my appointment was cancelled so I lost even more time before I realized. I went to CVS minute clinic and on 15 mins had a prescription from the nurse practitioner. The whole thing left a very negative impression.

name: Teladoc
title: Medicine
author: smishalanie
content: I called needing stronger medicine for athletes foot. Dr. called in over the counter medicine I was already using.

name: Teladoc
title: Very Disappointing Service
author: Fe Lie On
content: I needed a doctor to look at my sons reaction to a bee sting. I was really hard to get registered since my wife was the primary account holder. The doctor finally called, I was never able to video call, because they still tried to contact my wife, the doctor spent less than a minute talking to me before prescribing a very strong steroid. I call the ask-a-nurse hotline after the call with the doctor and they told me it was an inappropriate drug to be give under the circumstances. Wasted $45.

name: Teladoc
title: Had to start over
author: Beccajoy82
content: When I tried to make the appointment and confirm it, I got a note that said I needed to schedule it out longer than one hour and I had to re-input the information over again instead of just being able to change the appointment time

name: Teladoc
title: Great Tool For Modern Medicine
author: jhicken2
content: This is great for busy people who can take 5 min on their phone VS 2 hours to go to a clinic. Thanks

name: Teladoc
title: Quick and easy
author: Katie8w
content: Very quick and easy to use

name: Teladoc
title: I Never Give 5 Stars
author: prierpourelle
content: 100% covered through my Cigna PPO; ZERO co-pay. I hate going to the doctor when I’m sick or hurt because I feel most of the time rest and staying at home is better medicine. This way I can get a doctor’s note for work, talk to my doctor right from my bed, and they will send any prescriptions needed to the pharmacy across the street. You can even upload pictures before your visit of anything you want them to see.

name: Teladoc
title: Waste of time and money
author: JMP987
content: I wouldn’t use again or recommend.

name: Teladoc
title: Super helpful!!
author: Respect it !!!
content: Super helpful- especially useful if you send detailed pictures or participate in video chat- Dr. called back like 10 minutes after I logged in, diagnosed my condition to the tee and sent prescription to the 24 hr pharmacy- all at 12:10 am! If you are an educated and organized patient, the doctors are highly qualified and efficient.

name: Teladoc
title: Easy peezy lemon squeezy
author: Mommy of two wild boys!
content: Thank you Teledoc! For what I would typically spend to go to a doc at an urgent care, I can spend 10$, show them the same things over the phone and have quick, immediate care, and prescriptions filled. The one time it took way longer than it should have we were refunded the $10 fee. The only thing I wish was changed is prescriptions. I needed a refill on my Xanax for a flight, and he couldn’t prescribe it, even though it was already prescribed by my typical primary doc. Same goes for anything like that (pain meds and anything controlled). Other than that my family has had consistently been pleased with Teledoc.

name: Teladoc
title: Caregiver
author: landtbuel
content: We have called 3 times to get this set up and it is STILL not set up correctly

name: Teladoc
title: Wonderful Counselor!
author: ENCOURAGED IN NM
content: I have been seeing Deborah Moore for depression and PTSD. She is very knowledgeable, current in her field of study, compassionate, and an effective counselor. She is able to very skillfully integrate mainstream psychological principles and techniques into my Christian belief system. She is helping me positively change my life. I highly recommend Deborah Moore!

name: Teladoc
title: Wonderful
author: meltmade
content: This saves so much time.

name: Teladoc
title: One star
author: mcombs0914
content: First of all, I set an appointment & waited for 45 minutes on video chat waiting for the doctor who never came. Finally I called customer service and they had a different doctor who called me. I was fine with that and wouldnâ€™t have given them a negative review just for that. I had pink eye and she faxed me a prescription. It was easier than going to the doctor just for pink eye. So that wasnâ€™t the issue. The issue is the billing. It was supposed to be a $40 fee. I entered my PayPal info knowing that I would pay whatever my insurance did not. However, they charged me the full amount right away. I thought, well.. they probably charge it to me until insurance pays and then Iâ€™ll be reimbursed. Nope. I received a letter in the mail from my insurance that they had paid the bill in full. They have on file the date that Teladoc cashed their check for $40. I have never been reimbursed. Somehow they get $80 for a $40 service and their customer service was useless. They would not help me but instead had me call the medical advice line for my insurance who had ALREADY PAID the bill? The fact is they should send me $40 back for overpayment but itâ€™s been 2 months and they are impossible to deal with.

name: Teladoc
title: Amazing!
author: taylor11714
content: If you have this with your insurance itâ€™s amazing! Fast, easy and free!!

name: Teladoc
title: Waste of time
author: Ricci1977
content: After over an hour of trying to get the website to operate properly.   I received a call from a doctor. Zero bedside manner. Rude and dismissive.   So here I am still sick with no answers or suggestions.   Never using this apps again.

name: Teladoc
title: Multiple symptoms
author: Lonnie LeRue
content: Only constructive criticism would be an option to choose multiple symptoms

name: Teladoc
title: Thank you
author: rodgersvin
content: This an amazing advancement in patient care.

name: Teladoc
title: Great resource
author: Nae1018
content: Always call within a short period of requesting a visit. Very convenient for unexpected symptoms.

name: Teladoc
title: Waste of time !!
author: jeff929
content: Tried to save time using Teladoc , but had to go to urgent care anyway  . Iâ€™m not even sure what this service is good for , Not even worth my five dollar co-pay .

name: Teladoc
title: With ease
author: carissak77
content: Itâ€™s so convenient to get a dr appointment right from your own living-room especially with littles.The sign up is easy to understand as well as requesting a doctor appointment! They call promptly to help you figure out whatâ€™s going on! Every doctor Iâ€™ve talked to In the last year has been very friendly. I do wish there was a note section to give slightly more preview.

name: Teladoc
title: Much needed
author: bkbetter
content: This has been a life saver for myself.

name: Teladoc
title: Minor complaints
author: JeffLikesStarTrek
content: Overall, great experience. My medication was sent to the nearest pharmacy to me after speaking with a doctor on the phone.  Great time saver. Way better than going to see a doctor, how ever the application itâ€™s self could use some improvements.  The username for the app must be ridiculously long and the app was glitchy to use.  Nevertheless, I would recommend this to a friend.

name: Teladoc
title: The best
author: Jbbeen1234
content: Love not having to wait at a doctors office

name: Teladoc
title: First trial - successful but had a couple of issues
author: TimmyD59
content: Unable to upload photo (multiple tries) and  Had problems choosing pharmacy..ğŸ˜Ÿ

name: Teladoc
title: Love it
author: Nememusha
content: I love he convenience of using this service. I donâ€™t have to drag my kids to the emergency room with me.

name: Teladoc
title: SO AMAZED!!!
author: iMannyy21
content: THIS APP IS THE COOLEST INVENTION EVER!!!

name: Teladoc
title: Top quality
author: Jeffshauling
content: This is the second time I have used Teladoc. The service is A+ very fast and simple to use, great for small issues and right from the comfort of my home. Keep up the good work !

name: Teladoc
title: Directions unclear
author: Sonja's mama
content: It is unclear how to sign up when you are an adult dependent. I had to call their customer service which was helpful but should not be necessary.

name: Teladoc
title: Waste of $5 and time
author: Scarpetta126
content: I have called and because of Teladocâ€™s restrictive policies, the doctor will not prescribe medication.  Rather than being a convenience, they recommend you to your pcp or urgent care center for treatment.  Teladoc refuses to list conditions they cannot treat so they can collect your $5 and move on to the next $5 caller.  Seems more of a corporate scam than a convenience.

name: Teladoc
title: Amazing!!!
author: florida girl 2018
content: This has saved us money and time!!!! Great app!!! Great service!!!

name: Teladoc
title: Waste of time
author: jcalifano
content: Doctor signed on only to find out his video wasnâ€™t working... then suggested I go see an optometrist to look at my eye. No surprise as he couldnâ€™t see it anyway. THEN still had the nerve to charge me $30 copay? Absolutely never using this again. Just go to your doctor.

name: Teladoc
title: Did not want to listen to symptoms
author: Michelle 2746@
content: This doctor did want want to listen to anything I had to say and was in a huge rush to get off the phone in under two minutes.  It did not sound as if she even looked at the pictures sent nor was it a video call.  Pretty much just told me to see a doctor when skin rash is listed as one of the items to call for.

name: Teladoc
title: Itâ€™s ok
author: S3n10r2
content: Itâ€™s good for minor issues, anything more than a cold I suggest urgent care or your own doctor. They rush through calls, ask what you have. Immediately prescribe a med then tell you to pick it up in a hour.. no care for customers or compassion.. could be due to high demand for doctors.. but they def donâ€™t take much time with their patients. Either way, itâ€™s good for minor things, and saves me a trip to the doctor.. so Iâ€™ll continue to use it.

name: Teladoc
title: Offered Over the counter Meds.
author: 5280Meg
content: Extremely Dissatisfied.

name: Teladoc
title: Everything is working great
author: Belsis666
content: Everything is working great and itâ€™s simple to use.

name: Teladoc
title: RIP off
author: Coats17
content: Charged me $10.00 for someone to call and tell me they couldnâ€™t fill my prescription. Literally a 5 second phone call. Deleting the app and will not recommend to anyone. Terrible.

name: Teladoc
title: Great app
author: CLgirlfan
content: Very easy to use.

name: Teladoc
title: A SERVICE LONG OVERDUE!
author: Patriotgirl55
content: I have wonderful health insurance. With that being said, getting ill on a weekend is extremely tough. Most doctors are closed and emergency rooms and urgent care are very long waits. TELADOC was an option my insurance offered me. Until now, I hadnâ€™t used it.  I made an appointment and received a call back within 10minutes! I office â€œvisitâ€� was easy and quick. I was prescribed medicine for my shingles as well as a doctors note for work, which I downloaded.  TELADOC is truly a health care option for the future and it saves needless time and money. To no avail, he told me to take Sudafed. Ok, letâ€™s try it. Sure. That and mucinex. Two days later I was worse and my ears were clogged.
