The doctor refused to do anything, even though itâ€™s on the list of things they can treat, and we were still charged for the visit. I then had to rush to urgent care where it was confirmed but by this time the blizzard had come in and we couldnâ€™t make it to the pharmacy due to there being accidents everywhere. We were lucky we made it home. I also know when my kids have an ear infection. Itâ€™s usually a secondary infection that follows a cold for them and then they get a fever and ear pain. I had 2 kids with these symptoms and it was a Saturday. I requested visits for both on teladoc. One doctor for one child said â€œYes, thatâ€™s typical of an ear infection so I will send over the prescription to the pharmacy.â€� And the other doctors gave me a really hard time and acted like I didnâ€™t know what I was talking about. I was afraid he also wasnâ€™t going to prescribe the antibiotic my son needed but he eventually did. It makes me hesitant to use this but I feel like itâ€™s my only option sometimes. author: Mo33333
content: My first experience with Teledoc started with a request being made around 11 pm for the 24 hour line. There is no option to delay this meeting after it has been requested. A scheduler asked if we could set meeting at 7:00am - leaving me no time to go to the pharmacy before my commute to work. Still, I understood; but the scheduler insisted a doctor had tried to call me and was unable to get through. I explained I had been waiting and hadn't received any calls. She proceeded to explain that I most likely didn't answer since they call from private numbers. I protested that I would have answered and she wrote me off. For someone waiting up until 2:00am for a call, with no option to reschedule, while experiencing some level of discomfort - this experience and blatant disregard for the truth - was very upsetting. Don't lie to your customers about calling.

title: Disappointed
author: RxStevieP
content: As a healthcare professional, there were 4 things wrong with my Teladoc session: 1.  After explaining that Iâ€™ve had a hacking cough for a week (non-smoker), the doctor said that the cause must be viral.  If it was longer than a week, then it was bacterial.  So, couldnâ€™t it be either/or at that point?  She didnâ€™t think so.  2.  If it was bacterial, she said I should get a script for Augmentin.  Problem is, I have a penicillin allergy.  Not exactly observant.  3.  After saying I was producing mucus, she didnâ€™t bother to ask what color it was, which could give an indicator of the cause.  4.  She recommended Mucinex-DM, which is a terrible product to recommend because while the guaifenesin component breaks up the mucus, the dextromethorphan prevents you from coughing it out, so it just sits there in someoneâ€™s lungs.    Bad recommendations.  Bad experience.  Disappointed.

title: Almost nothing works or...
author: DeadboltSecurity
content: This is the most non-intuitive program I think I've ever worked with. Four example, I just launch the app on my Apple Watch and all it gives is a big microphone. If you touch the microphone you can make a note recording. From there if you go to their website or you go to the app there is absolutely no place where I can see that that note shows up. You set up all of your prescription drugs in The app and then when you want to indicate that you have taken your medication where do you do that from? Absolutely non-intuitive.  Every bit of instructions that I found on this program cover perhaps 5% of what this program appears to do. This program has been one of the biggest waste of my time up any app I've ever tried.

name: The Diary Health App
title: Promising, But Buggy!
author: karen.eliz.mcgee
content: I was really excited about this app! I'm looking for something new to help me manage my medications, primarily, and was encouraged by the App Store Editor's feature of this app. However, the app has been incredibly buggy; I've tried it out for a few days but it spends about 80% of its time trying to refresh and only about 20% actually being accurate and responsive. I'm excited that it includes such extensive features beyond simple medication reminders - opportunities to track refills, sleep, BMs, nutrition, water, etc - but it's too buggy to use reliably right now. Its main buggy issue is that it gets stuck in an infinite loop of refreshing; I can't actually check things off my list when I do them because it's refreshing ad nauseam without fully loading! I'd also suggest some standardization on the Feelings feature - either some standard inventory of feelings, or the option to easily view what individual feelings you've listed in the past so you can check if those are worse, same, or better.   I'll check back on future updates but for now, it's not my app of choice for meds and symptom tracking!

I love the integration with Apple Health, but am a little disappointed it one goes one direction. Would it be possible to have this app write entries into the Apple Health app as well as read them please? Would be SUCH an amazing time saver!

name: The Diary Health App
title: Simple, Useful, and Beautiful
author: soccerchicita
content: The Diary is easy to use and has a great variety of personal health stats that are beneficial to be aware of. I have introduced this app to my 71 year old grandmother, who is a type 2 diabetic, and she was easily able to record her blood pressure. The display is beautiful with a modern look, but easy enough to use for those who may not be so tech savvy, such as my grandmother. One feature she enjoys is the step counter. The percentage display is steps taken is motivating for anyone to reach their goal. Another one of the many useful features is being able to track the medications you're taking and what you have already taken throughout the day. This gets rid of the confusion if you've forgotten what medicine you've already had. The ability to chose widgets in the home screen makes it more accessible and personalized for the user so that they can see what they need to by just opening the app. I personally recommend this app to everyone because knowing your body is the first step in to living a healthier life. The Diary has made that desired healthier lifestyle within reach for every one of its users.

title: App is fantastic, new favorite health app
author: Tomwildcat9
content: This app is excellent. Love how it syncs with the phone's health app and pulls in my data. The widgets give me a great overall outlook of my health data. Also, I love being able to scan in documents and view later.

name: The Diary Health App
title: Health
author: Leadbottom lucy
content: Love it

name: The Diary Health App
title: Fast Data Entry is Great!!!
content: Can't stop using 3D Touch on my 6s Plus to dictate entries. It's just so fast to enter all my data. Don't think I'll be typing my medical records any time soon!!! Interface is clean and simple to use!

name: The Diary Health App
title: I can find all own MY health records
author: Patti in Tucson
content: Thank you.  This is awesome. Can't wait for the next time a doctor asks me when my last tetanus shot was. I will have the info at my finger tips

name: Emrify - Personal Health Record
title: Bar bones app
author: Ripsnort54
content: Cannot send medical info. Cannot enter much detail.

name: Emrify - Personal Health Record
title: Personal medical notes
author: Shelby Hoang
content: Exactly what I was looking for!! I have all my medical notes for everyone in my family handy at all times on allergies, date and illness, emergency trip with date, what it was for, and comments. I’ve tried diff apps and none had this many options. I had an emergency situation with my son and had a hard time remember all his medical allergies episodes and dates, to give to the first responder, now I don’t have to worry, it’s nice to have notes to refer back to.

name: Emrify - Personal Health Record
title: Can’t log into this app.
author: Noelaines
content: I verified my account. It states I didn’t. I entered forgot password and still never received an email. There is nothing in my spam folder.  Please fix.

name: Emrify - Personal Health Record
title: Shouldn't need to enter email add
author: Paladin306
content: Before you even enter a single digit it wants your email address.  Nope, not for me.

name: Emrify - Personal Health Record
title: Easy to keep track
author: AbaElena
content: Just started putting in information and it's easy to add. I like that I can add any information.

name: Emrify - Personal Health Record
title: Retired
author: Margo3252
content: New to site.  So far so good.

name: Emrify - Personal Health Record
title: Mrs smowwolf06
author: Snowwolf06
content: Just downloaded so still learning the app

name: Emrify - Personal Health Record
title: Finally an all in one healthcare app
author: DSkyline
content: Finally an all in one healthcare app with potential!

name: Emrify - Personal Health Record
title: Great app
author: Bdc63
content: Easy to use and very helpful

name: Emrify - Personal Health Record
title: Patients have power in one EHR
author: AF615
content: I struggle to track down my medical history between doctors in 3 different cities where I've lived. Now I can aggregate all that information in one secure place... and right on my smartphone.  Great first release and looking forward to more updates and cool features.

name: Emrify - Personal Health Record
title: Easy to use
author: SlickGeek
content: Simple to use than other ones.

name: Emrify - Personal Health Record
title: Great job to Emrify
author: S. Steve Samudrala MD
content: Happy we finally have an option to be the 'Mint' of Our Healthcare Records :)

name: Emrify - Personal Health Record
title: Excellent personal health tracker/aggregator
author: Stoves
content: Finally a quality app that allows me to keep all of my personal health info in one place. Great feature set for a first release. Looking forward to even more features in the future!

name: Personal Records
title: Great so far!
author: MLB39
content: I’ve tried a few apps, and am annoyed with the complications of use- I don’t need bright colors, and a million icons- I want simple, track my PRs, help me grow here! This app isn’t frilly, and doesn’t need to be!

name: Personal Records
title: Simple & Easy
author: galenandrew
content: Exactly what you want in an app to track lifts and PRs!!

name: Personal Records
title: Check your PR’s in the middle of a workout!
author: Koppenhofer
content: Love this app! I CrossFit at a box and my phone is in a locker so I needed something that would allow me to see my PR’s and calculate weight percentages on the fly (like when your coach says “I want you to deadlift at 80% of your max”). This app allows that since it’s on my watch! Yes, my box uses Wodify but who has time to try and sift through that while everyone else wants to check theirs too! This app on the watch makes it a split second decision on what weight to use. I also love that you can customize your categories and filters to make the list work with whatever type of workouts you do.

name: UPMC Health Plan
title: Very disappointed
author: DVT Prone Mom
content: Loved when they previously used MyChart app and I could email my doctor and check test results without having to log into a computer.  Was wonderful to be able to access it during my lunch hour because we are not allowed to use company computers for personal business.   Now I have to wait until I get home and most doctor’s offices do not take calls after 4:00 when you have questions.   What should be made easier is not.

name: UPMC Health Plan
title: Down for maintenance???
author: app scrutinator
content: I was told to move to this app and it says down for maintenance..  been saying that for 2 months

name: UPMC Health Plan
title: Down for maintenance
author: MjacobPGH
content: App has been down for maintenance for days since downloading.

name: UPMC Health Plan
title: Useless
author: Ajdtymco
content: I give it a one only because there’s nothing lower. This app is a joke it contains none of my medical information 2 days after my dr visit and none of my pharmacy information either. Fix it or remove it from the App Store .

name: UPMC Health Plan
title: Pathetic
author: pscreed
content: It’s incredible to me how much we pay for healthcare vs what we receive in quality. This app is a perfect example - it’s great unless you expect to receive a response other than “an unexpected error has occurred - please try again later”. Utterly and completely useless. UPMC should go back to fax lines and filing cabinets. Oh wait they never left.

name: UPMC Health Plan
title: This app doesn’t work! I will rate it better when it is fixed!
author: cntry82txn
content: So my company is using this provider to conduct a health challenge with monetary rewards. The app promises to link your iOS health data to a step tracker on the providers side in order for that data to be automatically counted in my company’s health challenge. Every time I try to enable this setting in the app it just gives me an error and tells me to try again later.

name: UPMC Health Plan
title: Not assessable
author: Stuffer601
content: Was told I it’s not available to me because of my insurance plan.

name: UPMC Health Plan
title: Not working
author: Nikkibaby8691
content: They were doing maintenance on this app and days after it's not letting me sign in at all before hand I was able to. How long is it going to take to fix it cause this is ridiculous

name: UPMC Health Plan
title: Does not currently work
author: Pynchi
content: I just downloaded this app and it doesn’t seem to work. As soon as I open it I get an error and I am unable to log in. I immediately uninstalled it.

name: UPMC Health Plan
title: Insurance Discrimination at its best
author: Chula333
content: Obviously the app only works for a private members. If you are a UPMC for you member it’s not for you. We are only affiliate of UPMC Health Plan.

name: UPMC Health Plan
title: Fresh Look
author: Themostcoolguyever
content: Looks awesome! New fresh look is pretty sleek. Looking forward to more updates. Keep working on features that are most useful for members.

name: UPMC Health Plan
title: App not the same as internet version
author: Superxbomber
content: So I can you my same old username and password word on the internet version of their service but when I try to use the application it telling me that it doesn't recognize my username or password. They need to get both these things up to date with each other.

name: UPMC Health Plan
title: Terrible
author: Jami@
content: The update stinks! It states an error occurred please try again later. What's up with that??? Why is it that every time you update, it doesn't work. Leave well enough alone!

name: UPMC Health Plan
title: Junk
author: nicholaswbarker
content: Doesn't work.  Unable to locate username after entering group ID. The app simple does not respond

name: UPMC Health Plan
title: Great.
author: Gregcheersykes
content: Most recent update is great!  I love the app. It's the main reason I opted for UPMC healthcare.   **Consider adding EOBs and graphs that show usage for out of pocket and deductibles. Thanks!!**  I like the in-app chat function.   Thanks for adding TouchID so I don't have to put in my password. Thanks.   Bug report: minor issue--small delay/latency when typing in ID card numbers etc. when signing up for app.   Wish list: 1) I wish I could import my ID card to Apple Wallet, 2) pay my premium with ApplePay. 3) Also, it'd be nice if I could also send a secure message to a customer service representative right from the app! 3) Instead of typing in member id#, make it scannable so the phone's camera can just grab the numbers off card. That'd be helpful.   4) Apple Keychain integration  3D Touch for quick ID card access?

name: UPMC Health Plan
title: Trash-- don't download it
author: accelerator bassman
content: Would not take my member ID, would not allow me to enter my username or password, would not let me reset either of those two, no phone number to call for support, no email for support -- typical UPMC. Found out about this from a direct mailer, even that has not a single phone number or email on it to contact for help. Why create an app that doesn't work?

name: UPMC Health Plan
title: Can't register
author: Gyrosauce
content: Trying to register, put all of my info in, click done, goes to a white screen and noting else. Please fix.

name: UPMC Health Plan
title: Tired and Broken
author: Sebac
content: This app has not been updated to support the screen sizes of the iPhone 6 family.  Many of the features show no information.  To the app author: fix it or get rid of it!

name: UPMC Health Plan
title: Nothing in it
author: docwhat
content: It's a very bare app.   Pros: - has card invade you lose physical one.  - has some prescriptions. But not over the counter.  - has dr. info.   Cons: - no fingerprint sensor support.  - no passport integration.  - no HealthKit integration.  - no way to message dr.  - no way to view lab results.  - no way to read dr. Messages - no over the counter prescriptions.  - it doesn't even have vitals from dr. appts.   Overall it is the minimal you could do and still say it successfully was an app.

name: UPMC Health Plan
title: Would love a Bill Pay feature
author: Voobu
content: Nice looking app.  I like the features but it feels partially done because there's no way to pay a bill or, in my case, my monthly premium.  Love the login pin...so easy.

name: UPMC Health Plan
title: Used to work
author: stack of cash
content: Liked this app. Unfortunately. It's not working anymore.  I reinstalled and the same error "unexpected error occurred please try again later".  Every day when I try to login

name: UPMC Health Plan
title: Caution I had problems with this
author: Rapowell64
content: After installing this app you are required to enter personal information to create an account. Including your upmc Id number. Last four of as number. Zip code. Enough info for identity theft. Then I got a message that said this app is not available for me and had to give email to be notified when it was. I hope it is a legit app and apologize if I'm wrong but I'm nervous that I bought into a scam.

name: UPMC Health Plan
title: Bumpy start but nice features
author: Sunlizard76
content: Recently improved account creation process.  Once the account was up and running the app provides some convenient account freatures.  First, switch login to 4 digit pin, quicker access. Don't need to carry insurance card any more with app version ( one less thing in the George wallet, see Seinfeld). Easy access  to FSA totals amount other things. Good base anticipate addition function in the future.

name: UPMC Health Plan
title: Meh
author: PaxSlavica
content: Can't create an account in app. Created online cannot sign in into the app. Unit testing? Nope haven't heard of that.

name: UPMC Health Plan
title: Great, useful app
author: Buccos37
content: The Rolls-Royce of health insurance apps

name: UPMC Health Plan
title: Very nice app
author: cleansheets
content: Easy to use, clean, and good performance. Well done.

name: UPMC Health Plan
title: Finally a health insurer got it right!
author: bnokjd
content: Great app! Very convenient! Easy access to your info, ID card, etc!!

name: UPMC Health Plan
title: A useful app
author: Cdawg412
content: Glad to have easy access to my member ID card!

name: UPMC Health Plan
title: 1st
author: Dragonfly030
content: cool app

name: UPMC Health Plan
title: Great app
author: Stacytpittsburgh
content: This app is beautiful and well thought out.  I love the MyHealth Circle which lists all the physicians I've seen - nice way to keep all this information organized.  Because I don't go to the doctor much I need a reminder of their exact location - love the location feature of my previously viewed physicians.  Also, my claims are there - perfect.  The Identification card is also nice...sometimes I don't carry anything but my iPhone and now I have my card right there! Thank you.

name: OpenTreatment Personal Health Record (PHR)
title: Helpful and EASY
author: John.Madden
content: Great UI- very easy to use. Thx for a helpful app!

name: OpenTreatment Personal Health Record (PHR)
title: Fantastic App
author: Shauna707
content: As a NP I am so happy to have the ability to have patients send in their intake form with ease and review their medications and history before they arrive.

name: OpenTreatment Personal Health Record (PHR)
title: Brilliant
author: TamsenE
content: Love the features of my intake forms all on one app. About time!

name: OpenTreatment Personal Health Record (PHR)
title: Outstanding App
author: MarshaD46
content: Finally an App that is easy to use and makes my medical journey effortless. Thank You!!!

name: OpenTreatment Personal Health Record (PHR)
title: An amazing app
author: dannnnnnnnnnnnniel
content: This is an amazing app that is great for checking out the fastest ER wait times.

name: Capzule
title: Best app ever
author: 007omar alqam
content: Perfect app

name: Capzule
title: Get rid of mandatory ads
author: chartru
content: Get rid of mandatory ads

name: Capzule
title: Baski Phamacist!
author: Kuttyma1
content: This is an awesome app. I recommend this app to my Patients, family and friends. You can keep all your appointments, allergies, health conditions in one place. Easier to email the information to healthcare professionals from app. You can manage your family’s healthcare at one place. User friendly!

name: Capzule
title: Lost data
author: TNT5506
content: Initially, I bought this at version 1.  I liked it but only needed to access it once or twice a year. So, when the iOS 11 update came out I was unaware that the app would not work. Fast forward to post iOS 11 update and version 1 no longer works. No backup of my data and can’t find a way to access or import the data to version 2. Poor planning on my part and the developers. They should have made it so we wouldn’t lose the data.  Also, I paid for the first version. Since iOS 11 and up do not support that version, it irritates me that I now must pay again (if I want to lose the adds) for a subscription. Wrong, just wrong.

name: Capzule
title: Best Medical app ever!
author: California Teaqueen
content: I have used Capzule for several years to keep track of medical information for family and friends. I tried several apps before settling on this one. I like how all the information is gathered in one place and it is easy to access. I use it all the time for every appointment, Information on meds and contact information. I love how you can attach pictures and documents. As said, everything is all in one place and that makes it super easy. I have been at Stanford and UCSF using this app and medical staff were very impressed!

name: Capzule
title: Super App
author: Minutemanjim
content: I have used this app for a few years now and I have all of our family’s medical history in one spot. Doctors are amazed how much information I readily have on hand. This is the best personal health record I found to date. Not thrilled with the ads popping up now and don’t plan on paying a recurring fee to get rid of them. I guess it is just business. I can live with them. Again, best app to record and track your family’s medical history. Would highly recommend it.

name: Capzule
title: CAUTION you will Lose your medical records!!!
author: urbanjalapeno
content: The idea behind this app is great and there is certainly a need given modern medicine BUT their execution is HORRIBLE. After using the app for a year or so there was an update and “Poof” all our records were gone and could no longer be recovered.  What happens next?? Nothing. You start over. There is no customer service, there is no phone number. Your records are simply gone. Think about it. You spend the time and energy to consolidate all your records in one place and then one day after an iOS update or app update they’re gone!

name: Capzule
title: No paid version with no adds
author: Chessplaya544
content: Based on other reviews and some testing it is not worth the time to put all your data into an app only to be consumed by adds.   Please give us an option for a paid version.

name: Capzule
title: Stunningly Awful!!!!  It was such a great App.
author: CathieLB
content: Hard to believe, but this app’s performance just goes from poor to very, very, bad.  And it was such a wonderful piece of software back in the day.  So sad.  I can no longer backup data - not in Google Drive or Dropbox, Clicking on Airdrop just causes the app to crash, and now not even emailing works!  The email is never sent.  So no more sharing between devices.  It has to be manually entered on each one!  Either fix the app so it works properly or just put it out of our misery!!!!

name: Capzule
title: Former favorite
author: Geaglin
content: Capzule was my former favorite, even with the ads. However it now stays open only for a couple of seconds after tapping icon, both on IPhone 6 and 8Plus. Would have been 5 stars except for this unfortunate glitch.

name: Capzule
title: Great Program
author: eriddle
content: This is the best medical record I have found on IOS. The only draw back is that sometimes there is an issue with merging data between two devices in fact the other day I did that and it crashed the program on both devices and to reinstall then restore from back. So make sure you back up anytime there are changes.

name: Capzule
title: Must have App
author: Maddie TAJ
content: I have been using this app for years and love it. I have two autoimmune disorders which require me to go to numerous doctors during the year. I totally depend on Capzule to keep me organized. When I’m referred to a new doctor, I have all my medications listed and history of my past medical procedures etc to review with doctor. I recently had problems with my iPhone 6 which made me get a new phone an iPhone 8. I had not been able to update my old phone for some time so I had not had any problems with Capzule. However with the iPhone 8 my Capzule would not work and I was lost!!  After much searching I found an updated app in the App Store and luckily I had backup in my cloud so I was able to restore everything to my new phone Praise the Lord! This app is awesome. Everyone needs it.

name: Capzule
title: Horrible
author: Starrbuxfrk
content: Had no chance to back up data before the app stopped working with last iOS update. Have my medical history but my other family’s was lost. Stupidly enough I bought the updated app (would’ve been nice if the developer let us download the new app for free as we’d already paid for it but NO). Paid for and downloaded the new app and now IT doesn’t work and is out if date. Complete waste of money, do not buy!

name: Capzule
title: Annoying ads
author: Dhuynh7888
content: Went from useful to terrible. Ads pop up constantly. Very heavy handed. App will load full page ads before even using. Agree with other reviewers. There’s no option to buy out. Been using this app for years. Develop switch app and old app no longer works with new iOS

name: Capzule
title: Can’t get help
author: ihandy1
content: I used the previous version for years.  That version is not supported by current iOS.   I can’t import data from old to new version.  There is no way to contact capzule for help.  I’ve essentially lost over 5 years of data for my chronically ill child.

name: Capzule
title: Best in class though still a few hiccups
author: PnUy8vtn6wh3
content: No other medical record application comes even close to the capabilities in Capzule. I use it for all medical consultations and demonstrate it for interested health provider personnel. Most of them are amazed and some express interest in possibly getting it. We are all appreciative of the local only data storage and no Internet connection required.  Two gotchas at this point (01/08/2018) with version 2.0.1 (iPad): a) no direct contact with any application support personnel, b) Dropbox and local network HTTP functionality doesn’t appear to work. Use of Dropbox pops up authorization window but no backup is ever performed (screen blinks after allowing access and then drops back to Capzule). Initiating local network transfer fails as Capzule never opens up the designated port.  b) HTTP connectivity: issue resolved - desktop multi-network control sequence Dropbox connectivity: issue not resolved; even after rebooting Capzule client devices the Dropbox Authorization process appears to work but no backup file is uploaded; screen immediately returns to Capzule

name: Capzule
title: Is app continuing?
author: Mommobile
content: This has got to be THE best app for health issues. I actually recorded each of my kids’  health records from their newborn records and their records for school. I wrote in a family history as well so that the kids can print it out and rake it to their own doctor appointments. I was able to upload medical reports and photos (ugh!) of my EGD scope! Incredible. Since my phone calendar doesn’t go back a whole year, I can look at the app to see whenI should get in for my annual exam.  Seriously, this app is all you need to carry around all your medical data for any appointments.  Start keeping your kids’ records with you for all pediatrician visits and jot down when they have all those childhood illnessss.

name: Capzule
title: Get a paid version
author: Free wildly
content: I’ve been using this app for awhile and loved it till the latest release with adds.

name: Capzule
title: Used to love this app until upgrade
author: Nopalita21
content: I used the old version of Capzule for several years and backed it up frequently. I loved the old version! However, ever since the upgrade to the new version, I can’t access my old back-up to transfer to the new version. So I guess I have to re-enter everything from memory which defeats the  purpose of having the old app that I can’t access!! If there is an IT person that can help resolve this issue then I’ll be happy to give this app 5 stars with raving reviews.

name: Capzule
title: Great health record
author: AndyA1947
content: I am so glad the Capzule app is updated. It allows for mobile health records which can be easily kept up to date.

name: Capzule
title: Very good app. Zero support
author: Jayip4
content: Very useful app. Rather than update app. A new app was created. Information from old app will not transfer and you obviously can’t open old app on new iOS to manually copy data. No way of contacting Capzule either.

name: Capzule
title: Love this app, but some issues and enhancements
author: mikeindm
content: Love the app, glad to see it back. I can deal with the ads, but would like to see a new pay version.  DropBox isn’t working for me. When I go into the tools or the backup, it asks me to allow the program to access Dropbox but it never lets me do a backup. I can backup to Google Drive with no problem.   I would like to see a way to remove data. I track my blood sugar and insulin usage daily. That’s 365 entries in a year and all I really need access to is the most recent 90-120 entries. Maybe a way to delete by date range? Or even a way to quickly mark a screen full of entries to delete.   Finally, I would like to store templates separately from my data. Lacking a way to mass delete data, I was thinking I could copy a template into self monitoring and call it Diabetes 2017, then copy it in as Diabetes 2018 and simply delete 2017 at some point. Thanks!

name: Capzule
title: Unable to move backup from Capzule  1.0 to 2.0
author: bogra2000
content: My backups are in iCloud. There a way to restore the 1.0 backup  from iCloud to Capzule 2.0. After upgrading to iOS 11 I can’t even start Capzule 1.0.  Please advise.... thanks

name: Capzule
title: Still no Dropbox Backup
author: Screen Walker
content: I’ve had this program for a long time and it’s great. Very useful & largely functional. But one concern is always, how to make sure your info is secure beyond just living on your phone?   I like to backup to a separate iPad when possible using Dropbox. That quit working a few weeks ago. The developer released an upgrade that was supposed to fix that. But now when I try the backup, I get sent to my Dropbox app to approve Capzule’s access. When I click to Allow, I get sent right back to the Capzule app with no backup happening. Try the backup again, get sent back to Dropbox again to allow access. OVER AND OVER. Something is not communicating right between those two. Please help!  Edit to add: developer contacted me, I can’t respond by e-mail or on their website though - only though the App Store on my phone, which I hate. Anyway: tried closing and launching both apps in various orders, same result. Deleted Dropbox & re-installed it, same result. Tap settings -> cloud symbol under Backup -> Dropbox; Dropbox launches and says “Capzule PHR Free would like access to files & folders in your Dropbox” -> tapping Allow causes the “Authorizing” box to momentarily appear, then Capzule reopens to the account page and the News folder flashes blue two times... but the only message in the folder is the Version 2.0.1 announcement. If I try to backup again the whole process repeats again. This is on an iPhone SE running 11.1.1 although I believe I was having difficulty backing up back on iOS 10. The newer version of Capzule seems to have introduced this endless loop though.

name: Capzule
title: Conversion from old app
author: sesposi
content: The app is great, but no notice was given that it was being updated and that the old data doesn’t transfer over in order to view as before- very disappointing!

name: Capzule
title: Thought this was a great app until
author: SJLeite
content: I open the app and I now get a pop up message that says “a new version is released with fix for iCloud and dropbox connectivity problem. Thank you” at the bottom of the box it says OK and takes you to the App Store which does not give you the option to update just to open the app and when you open the app the same message appears therefore I cannot access any of the information in the app. UPDATE: The next day there was an update option in the App Store which I did and now the app is running perfectly.

name: Capzule
title: Used to be 5 stars
author: JDfoto
content: My biggest complaint is the irritating ads which now randomly pop up while I'm trying to take notes in the doctors office. They are full page and require you to click them off before you continue. I'm irritated by this, But it's still a really great app. Please bring back the paid app without ads, and I will pay more for it and give you 5 stars again!

name: Capzule
title: Lost all data with iOS 11
author: FlCeph
content: I found this app very useful. But after my iPhone update to iOS11 I’m unable to access the app or transfer the data to the new version. Very inconvenient. I will look for a new app.

name: Capzule
title: Ok for a free app
author: MonkeyRules
content: Been using it since 2014.  New upgrade is VERY similar to old v1.0 with 2 big FLAWS!  Unable to import data from old app unless you had them backed up separately!  Now there are pop-up ads (annoying). So instead of re-entering data all over again, purchase an ad free app and start from scratch!

name: Capzule
title: Give us a paid option pronto!
author: Bahia97
content: I’ve been using the app for a few years, it really keeps me organized, love the calendar integration and prescriptions list. I refer to it every doctor’s visit. I’m older now and not having to memorize my meds and dosages is very handy. I’m also very happy the app is now iOS 11 compatible but now its ad sponsored and I really don’t like that at all. Today I was prompted to watch a video and the sound was on. Having this go off while I was in a meeting was aggravating. I’d gladly pay for the app to get rid of this. Without it I may have to look elsewhere to record my medical data.

name: Capzule
title: I Agree with KB0804!!
author: Lucy Brown2
content: I agree with everything in that review! I love this app! Please, please keep it going!

name: Capzule
title: Upset customer
author: IdeneP
content: I had the old paid version of capzule. I updated my phone to the new iOS 11 software for my phone and went to open the app and it states that it isn’t supported by the new software update. I try to update & can’t. I downloaded the newest version to see if I can have the information migrated over and I can’t. 7+ years of medical records of me and my family- GONE!! There is no way to contact the developer to get an answer. I tried following the steps on the page with no success. I can’t find an email- nothing. I’m so upset, frustrated and disappointed that they would do this.

name: Capzule
title: Bring Back Paid Version!
author: Sini42
content: This is a fantastic app. My wife uses it religiously, and nothing out there compares. We were very disappointed when there was no iOS 11 support, but thrilled beyond belief when you released the tweaked ad-supported version here. But please, give us the option to pay for ad removal. There are those like us who are so appreciative of your software, we’d be willing to pay (again) for this “new” version!

name: Capzule
title: Thank you, thank you, thank you
author: Phila chick
content: I had all but given up my precious app when 2.0 appeared. I’ve been using this app since 2012 and depended heavily on it especially as I age and have more doctors appointments. I almost missed out transferring my info as IOS 11 overran my iPad but you saved the day. A bit tricky at first to figure out transferring old info. It would be helpful to give a way to restore from an old backup if Capzule 1 was rendered non functional. Syncing (or fixing sync) with Dropbox would give it 5 stars for me. Don’t leave again please.

name: Capzule
title: Updated....where’s all my data?
author: COOKIE101T
content: Thanks for updating the app for iOS 11, however, years of data is gone.

name: Capzule
title: I LOOOVVVEEE this App!!
author: mpaul389
content: I guarantee you that I am beyond abnormal when it comes to keeping detailed PHR (personal health records), and I take much pride in staying organized and on top of my medical history. Having many medical issues and having to see many different doctors, it’s so nice to have everything in one place that is very clean, visually appealing, and user friendly. I was freaking out when I thought they did away with the app, but now it contains ads (I originally paid the $20, but I’m just glad I still have my Capzule HR!) TRUST ME...I have tried them all and nothing comes close to this app.  Please continue to remain in the App Store forever!

name: Capzule
title: Can old data from the original be moved to 2.0
author: BeckyLuvsBooks
content: I love this app. Used the old version for years. I didn’t know where else to ask this question.   If I have already updated to iOS 11, Is it possible to transfer information from the previous app to the new 2.0 version? I am worried it will not be able to access my original data.   Thank you for your help!!  UPDATE: Thank you for the quick response. I did back it up, but to iCloud. Will I be able to access it from iCloud?

name: Capzule
title: Update removed my paid features
author: AnimeImp
content: I paid for Capzule 1.0. I was overjoyed to see that they put out 2.0 so I would not lose it during the 11.0 upgrade. But they put out a add supported only version, ignoring those of us who paid $4.99 for the previous add free app. And when you go to app support, you are directed to their website with *no* way to contact them via email or form. So the took our money and then put out a mandatory upgrade that removed the paid features, and I am left with no choice but to leave a 1 star review.

name: Capzule
title: Can't transfer Capsule 1 data to Capsule 2
author: Just want I wanted
content: My husband and I have used and relied on Capsule to maintain our medical records for over 5 years. To use this new version we must re-enter our profiles and all our medical data. That's not acceptable. Please provide a link to resolve this issue.  Thank you for your response. I was able to transfer our data and all is well. Like some of the changes such as being able to add physician from appt screen.

name: Capzule
title: Love this app!
author: artsygeek
content: I've used this app for quite awhile and it has become indispensable for me. I am able to schedule my appointments in the app and they automatically show up in my calendars. I take a photo of my lab results to put in Capzule's files. I can put lab results like blood pressure and cholesterol into Capzule and see at a glance results on a chart. Backup has been smooth and sharing within my devices works fine. At the doctor's office I am able to access any medical info in seconds. I know Capzule needs to place ads to keep developing it so that doesn't bother me. It would be nice to have the option to pay to eliminate the ads like so many other apps do. Thanks for a wonderful app!

name: Capzule
title: Use to love it
author: Rummomma
content: I always loved this app until the new updated version.  I hate the pop up adds.  Isn't there a way to get rid of them. If so I would give it 5 stars

name: Capzule
title: Cannot restore backup from 1.3.1
author: Yourdysfunctionhere
content: The instructions to use airdrop to restore a backup of 1.3.1 data to migrate to 2.0 does not work.  It crashes the app.  It actually crashes both versions, repeatedly and reliably.  Since there is no other way to restore data from the previous version, I'm stuck.  Time to migrate to something else I guess.  UPDATE: I was able to restore from backup using dropbox.  The airdrop issue was limited to the iPad, but I could not get an iPhone and iPad to recognize capzule on each device.  The instructions and capabilities provided are in some cases incomplete and in others wrong, as they refer to capabilities that do not function.

name: Capzule
title: Absolutely rely on this app
author: newbie 12
content: I love this app, really rely on it to keep track of my medical history, including prescribed medications. It's comprehensive and easy to use, and has proven its worth many times over, including during medical appointments.  The ads aren't greatly intrusive, but I would gladly pay for an ad-free version.

name: Capzule
title: Love it! But...
author: ClarielWicked
content: I had the last version and I loved it too.  The only thing I've noticed is that there's advertising on the new one and no way so far to remove.  I also haven't found a way to contact them to ask questions like how to remove the advertising.

name: Capzule
title: Please don't ever stop making this app!
author: KB0804
content: I have literally never written an app review before. However, I felt compelled to do so because I can't imagine keeping track of my families medical records without this app. When I learned that it would not be supported in iOS11, I downloaded over 10 other PHR apps but none even came close to what this one can accomplish.  Andaman7 was the best alternative I found , but the lab tracking leaves much to be desired.  Capzule is by far the easiest to use, most comprehensive in terms of what info you can store, and has the best UI of any PHR app out there. My only wish is that I could pay them a lump sum to remove the adds. But the company has to be able make money to keep developing the app.  Thank you soooooo much for keeping this app going.

name: Capzule
title: Wondering
author: Tmatteson
content: This app is "one of a kind."  It allows you to accurately record records.  I used it much with my wife's cancer up to the point of her death...it provided continuity of care instructions and documented well test results.  It is disappointing to find this version full if adds...I use it because it is good for my own medical challenges but the adds are a nuisance.  Don't know why developers can not create purchase option...

name: Capzule

content: Пользоваться невозможно

name: Capzule

content: This app is exactly what I've been wanting!  This replaced 3 other apps.

The dashboard shows green indicators for when the daily measurement is in the healthy range. Love this app. The only things I would ask them to improve is 1- let it talk to the Apple Health app, and 2- don't try to fit BMI and weight on the same graph because the range is too huge.

author: Bootsy62
content: App does not save some of the corrections to entries.  Charting does not adjust to high / low range so changes in day to day readings impossible to see on charts.   Spend your $$ on another app

name: Health Tracker & Manager for iPhone - Personal Healthbook App for Tracking Blood Pressure BP, Glucose & Weight BMI
title: Good App with big attitude problem
content: There should be one screen for input all the data and then store data and display the graphs later. When entering input such dates, or weight then the app uses its own brain for instance if you wish to enter the time when you checked your sugar levels even though you remember the time best of luck in entering (or I should say save) it. Most of all this app does is to help to keep the logs in place when seeing the doctor instead of searching wallet/purse or pockets for stickies or post-it notes.

name: Health Tracker & Manager for iPhone - Personal Healthbook App for Tracking Blood Pressure BP, Glucose & Weight BMI
title: Great app
author: Ms V61
content: Keeps me from scrabbling to find scraps of paper that I've written my numbers on.  Now I go to the doctor zinc pull up my app and it's all there.

name: Health Tracker & Manager for iPhone - Personal Healthbook App for Tracking Blood Pressure BP, Glucose & Weight BMI
title: Great potential, sorely lacking support
author: FLladydoc
content: I need an update and none is available. Input weight will not change, nor height from day to day. It just won't take the data.  I don't mind the wheel and BP graph is nice.  I would like to recommend to my patients but can't. Fix it gentlemen/ladies!

name: Health Tracker & Manager for iPhone - Personal Healthbook App for Tracking Blood Pressure BP, Glucose & Weight BMI
title: Potentially great, but right now, a waste of money
author: Tom McElvy
content: This app has a LOT of potential, but the developer seems to care less.  I say that, because they have not responded to ANY emails I have sent.  1.  The dashboard - it only displays the latest entry for a metric.  It should be showing a total average.  Additionally, to select a metric for entry, you have to find it on a little menu on the bottom.   We should be able to just touch that section on the dashboard.  2.  No provision for mass data import, in order to bring old info from another program in.  Export seems to be limited to sending an email to yourself.  It seriously needs a inport/export component.  3.  The use of wheels for data entry is insane.  Some entries can vary widely, and it would be more efficient to use a keypad for the numeric entries.  Fast, simple, and easy to work with.  If the author makes these mods, I believe I could give it 5 stars.  But not until then.

name: Health Tracker & Manager for iPhone - Personal Healthbook App for Tracking Blood Pressure BP, Glucose & Weight BMI
title: Dont by this app until it is straightened out (VER 1.3)
author: emsi candidate
content: You need a weight resolution of tenths of a pound. Full pounds is not good enough. I thought that I had the perfect app until I paid the money and discovered this. Pretty expensive not to have that resolution on the pounds. Please fix this and you will get five stars from me. (UPDATE) Upon further examination I find that the data that I enter is changed, somewhat arbitrarily. I enter 221 and 67 inches and it shows up as 220 and 66 inches. What is up with that. This app needs some work. I would guess internally it is storing things in kg and meters and the conversions to pounds and inches are causing some issues. Likely because of the internal resolution it is being stored in. Just my belief.

name: Health Tracker & Manager for iPhone - Personal Healthbook App for Tracking Blood Pressure BP, Glucose & Weight BMI
title: Buyer beware
author: mrstevee
content: Only goes to 300lbs, will not let you edit an entry.  All not good

name: Health Tracker & Manager for iPhone - Personal Healthbook App for Tracking Blood Pressure BP, Glucose & Weight BMI
title: Overall, okay but...
author: PRbuick
content: Still needs some tweaks. First, you need the ability to edit previous entries. I realized, after I clicked "save," that I must have inadvertently moved my height dial when entering my weight--now the graph for my BMI on that date takes an odd turn, as well as my height line.   Speaking of the height curve--it's totally unnecessary. This data point should be set on the same screen where we set our unit preferences. It certainly doesn't need its own number wheel next to the weight wheel, nor its own line on the BMI chart-- I think it's safe to assume that this is fairly constant in most people and if, for some reason, it must be corrected, it should be done in the settings menu.   On the plus side, I think the navigation and data entry is very easy and simple, and the adjustable graph function is very nice and easy to read.

name: Health Tracker & Manager for iPhone - Personal Healthbook App for Tracking Blood Pressure BP, Glucose & Weight BMI
title: Needs Work
author: dwpda
content: Standard for blood sugar doesn't take into account when it was taken - can't edit values

name: Health Tracker & Manager for iPhone - Personal Healthbook App for Tracking Blood Pressure BP, Glucose & Weight BMI
title: Con
author: Pkgro
content: This app does not have any editing features.  And you can not go back and add earlier test or weight results.

name: Health Tracker & Manager for iPhone - Personal Healthbook App for Tracking Blood Pressure BP, Glucose & Weight BMI
title: Great App
author: Travis Donaho
content: I've found only minor problem in the graphing of systolic and diastolic , their colors are not properly set with right word.  As for the rest of the App, I can't help but love it.

name: Health Tracker & Manager for iPhone - Personal Healthbook App for Tracking Blood Pressure BP, Glucose & Weight BMI
title: Pro?
author: whitedove22
content: Only goes to 300 lbs. Can not edit date or time. Correct these and get 5 stars.  Hmm goes to excel but 2 diff files. One for bp and one for sugar. Would rather both be on one file to print out. Why waste paper. And it will be a hassel printing out 2 diff files. Hope I don't regret buying this. But probly will. Unless updated very soon will stay at 3  think green

name: Health Tracker & Manager for iPhone - Personal Healthbook App for Tracking Blood Pressure BP, Glucose & Weight BMI
title: Latest Update
author: drend
content: Just downloaded latest update and all issues that I had about using US units have been fixed. Does all it says and is very useful. I use it all the time.

name: Sanford
title: Ok app, annoying notifications
author: Right Side
content: This is a nice app that provides a lot of functionality, including communication with my doctor and nurse. My only negative comment is that it sends email notices saying to check the app for new info even after I have looked at the info, several times. Very annoying. I turned notifications off.

name: Sanford
title: Crashes
author: Kappelb
content: Since recent iOS updates it does not work.

name: Sanford
title: Great App!
author: fischgeek
content: This app is awesome! I especially love the wait time visibility. Very helpful.

name: Sanford
title: Wow!
author: MamaJonie
content: I can connect with my doctor, I can find a clinic and any phone number I need. Thank you Sanford Health!

name: Sanford
title: Great app!
author: DakotaChemist
content: I was able to quickly find doctors, clinics, and ERs near my location.  The access to personal healthcare records such as lab tests and medical visit summaries, and immunizations is really useful and innovative.  Download this app!

name: PortalConnect
title: Needs work
author: Artist8
content: Good idea but fails to do much, only good at updating appts and emails. Test results never appear when they should.

name: PortalConnect
title: Issues need addressed!
author: Sk84Ash
content: Cannot open labs or attachment from provider via app. The app is pretty much only good for messages. If you have a family plan you cannot switch between family members without logging out.

name: PortalConnect
title: Inferior service
author: Artay98
content: This "service" is supposed to connect patient with your Doctor's office. It was definitely not the case in my experience as response time and ability to keep test results and records were poor, at best.  Definitely not worth the money.

name: PortalConnect
title: HORRIBLE!!!
author: UhDiggaDigga
content: Can I give it zero stars? It won't work! So frustrated!!! Just like all the other reviews say, you can't login! It is the most bizarre thing! They were saying my user name and password were incorrect, which I didn't think so at all. However, I went ahead and requested a new password. They ask you to do one of those capcha things- where they jumble up letters and numbers to make sure you are a person and not a computer...you know what I'm talking about, right? Anyways, there is NO getting past that. YOU WILL FAIL. No matter if you think you just aced that little mini test, YOU. WILL. FAIL. Then there is no chance for you to get in. None. Nada. Zilch. Good luck to you! My experience was like everyone else's reviews on here thus far- portal connect stinks!!!!

name: PortalConnect
title: App doesn't work
author: Ronald Klein
content: Can't access and app from login screen and the forgot password link doesn't work!!

name: PortalConnect
title: WONT WORK FOR ME!
author: Word Whomp player
content: I downloaded it for my iPhone just like it instructed, put in my credentials and Password just like before when I was going under the old app,… And it keeps telling me to verify my credentials and try again. I have done it over and over and over again making sure my credentials are correct and it will not let me in.

name: PortalConnect
title: Password request won't work
author: Jbrown2339
content: Unable to get my password, when I click on "forgot my password" nothing happens.  When I try to use the website, I keep getting errors when I request my password to be reset.  Basically I am locked out of my own results from the lab work my doc did for me.

name: PortalConnect
title: Slow and unable to access documents scares me when you do not get important health messages
author: kellykat09
content: Blue "Circle of death" keeps turning but never gives you access to the essential information on your health and lab test. Hope no important messages are sent from doctor because I could end up in the blue circle of death.

name: PortalConnect
title: Not useful
author: 1Dgirl1024
content: The one feature that's really needed is scheduling appointments. Face it. Most doctors are just going to use this service for scheduling, messaging and payment. Messaging works but payments and scheduling are missing. Not very useful.

name: PortalConnect
title: good idea but poor execution
author: jjara47
content: both the website and app are terrible. i can’t believe i have to use this service, and it’s not free! crashes, issues with flash in a browser, and now i’m being told on the app that i’m logged in somewhere else. huh? manually logging off all other devices and restarting my iPhone does not help. i checked the corporate blog for help and it looks like you’ve gone out of business because there’s only one post this year. hello frustration!

name: PortalConnect
title: Poorly Designed
author: Antakaya
content: I had trouble with the Web site on my iDevices (no Adobe Flash) so had to get the app. Does function barely. Given these issues and others with registration,  I do not trust the security of my medical records and correspondence with my doctor. I agree with other reviewers that this company is not up to speed and I won't pay their annual fee to join.

name: PortalConnect
title: Scam
author: Johnny_gs
content: This company charges you to use this service. The doctor will have you sign in with an iPad and you will be automatically enrolled. Stick to paper if they want charge for this madness

name: PortalConnect
title: Generally good
author: Uliajay77
content: I've been using this because my doctors office started doing a lot with it, and generally I think it's alright. My only problem so far is that when I was trying to write a message to the doctors office today, after about a paragraph the text started disappearing. If it weren't for that (and me having to edit/condense info that I couldn't really do so to) I would be very happy with everything

name: PortalConnect
title: Doesn't work
author: Poopy2theMax
content: The idea is great, but consistently have problems. Get mssg that labs are available, but can't access them on app. Ever. And with the latest update, app no longer opens.

name: PortalConnect
title: Doesn't work
author: Bluekrush00
content: This app doesn't work at all with the new iOS versions that's why it crashes when you log on. Very disappointed since I'm paying for a service I can't use!

name: PortalConnect
title: Keeps closing, can't see anything
author: Missa4fusion
content: Loved it till past month.  Log in and then app just closes.  Frustrating.

name: PortalConnect
title: So bad it's hard to put into words
author: The Sidewinder Three-Thousand
content: UPDATE: Now even worse! Does not work for iOS 8. Crashes every time. Do these clowns have ZERO pride? They charge my doctor a lot of money to provide this service and they are operating in BAD FAITH! This is how people communicate with their doctors. Shameless.  -------- This app is a new low in bad design, bugs, and crashing/freezing. If your Doctor uses this company for medical records, do not pay for the service if you want ANY mobile functionality.   Their website uses Flash, so this app is supposed to "fill in the gap" for mobile users. It doesn't. Even sending your doctor a simple email is a frustrating chore that yields unreliable results. The cursor often disappears, making it almost impossible to edit or type, and if you have a conversation going with the provider you can only see the last email in that conversation. A complete and utter joke.   - Don't waste time with this app. It may actually make you sicker. - Don't pay for a Hello Health medical records subscription. Any tech company that embraces Flash and doesn't build their web services for mobile first is wildly incompetent, and unworthy of safeguarding your medical information. - Tell your doctor to find a new medical records provider.

name: PortalConnect
title: Crashes immediately after logging in
author: justinforeman
content: Please fix this application. As others have mentioned, it crashes immediately after logging in. I'm running iOS 8.0.2 on an iPhone 6.

name: PortalConnect
title: Doesn't Work
author: Davidm6375
content: Can't even log in without it crashing.

name: PortalConnect
title: Junk
author: boomdelux
content: Pretty much worthless. Perhaps they need to rework app for iOS 8. Until then it's worthless

name: PortalConnect
title: Doesn't work anymore.
author: Lotusblossom09
content: This stopped working after the IOS 8 update.

name: PortalConnect
title: All good except cannot choose another patient after you already chosen one
author: S姐姐
content: Also msg cannot attach imgs. It is good for checking information, that's all.

name: PortalConnect
title: Doesn't open on iPhone 4s
author: phigirl
content: My doctor recently switched to this system. Since the website uses Flash (really? In 2014?) and I'm mostly mobile I downloaded the app. Well it's useless since it won't even open on my iPhone 4s. I'm deleting it, and certainly not paying for the service. Not that I see why I should pay to access my own medical records in the first place, but had the app actually worked I probably would have done it just for the convenience. You bet I'll be complaining to my doctors office about this too, since I'm sure they also pay for the 'convenience' of this system

name: PortalConnect
title: Total crap
author: stan floots
content: If your doctor wants you to sign up for this. Make sure you cancel it in the first 30 days. Don't waste your time trying to use it, you will just get frustrated.

name: PortalConnect
title: Needs improvement
author: Vicbri
content: I really wish you would fix all the bugs with this ap. I keep thinking you will improve it, not no updates have been done. Please fix it. We pay enough for the service, you can put some money into improving this ap.

name: PortalConnect
title: Horrible
author: Barrera 217
content: Trying to open up message files and it won't allow it at all what a waste of an app

name: PortalConnect
title: Buggy and Crashes
author: JulesFrog
content: My doctor, who I like very much, decided to go with PortalConnect. So far, I must say the service is a disappointment.  The app crashes quite often on my iPhone 4S when trying to open labs. If it doesn’t crash, it just sits there and does nothing. So, I have to go to my desktop to retrieve the document (not everybody has a desktop nowadays). By the way, not that it’s related to the app, the desktop experience is far from being intuitive and is built entirely in Flash.  Anyway, this lack of performance worries me when it comes to have my medical information hosted with this company. If the code is buggy, is my information safe? I doubt. I hope my doctor find a new platform soon.

name: PortalConnect
title: App Crashes
author: Mobupp
content: I just downloaded the app, and I tried to make an appointment. There is no key/icon to make/change an appointment. Also, the app crashed at least 5 times in the 10 minutes since I downloaded it.

name: PortalConnect
title: Crashes Alot
author: Laszlo
content: Have used application today for first time and continuously crashes when moving between "modules" especially the "Appointments" module. Needs a lot of work from my experience. Currently unusable.

name: PortalConnect
title: Crashes
author: Captino
content: When trying to view one's profile, the app crashes. I'll reboot my phone and try again.

name: PortalConnect
title: Not sure
author: ACarrera98
content: The app keeps kicking me off when I click on profile. I can't give you a rating because since I downloaded this app almost 2 weeks ago it hasn't worked once!  I have yet to be able to log onto my profile. Once you get this app working I will give you a real review.

name: PortalConnect
title: Great APP
author: Mushkabibels
content: Great application. Mobile access to my health information and doctor!

name: PortalConnect
title: Thank You
author: Fergie poops
content: Just wanted to say thank you for such a great way to connect with my doctor.   Not only can I message them from anywhere but having my medical record with me wherever I go is such a great comfort.

name: CareSync | Care Coordination
title: Amazing!
author: Handsnotfull
content: CareSync was able to the retrieve medical records for our adopted child that our agency was unable to get. The app helps me coordinate my childâ€™s care among a team of 8 specialists. Thank you for helping us keep our child healthy!

name: CareSync | Care Coordination
title: I like where their going, but...
author: DJ Hunt
content: In the past I would have given this app ra;ve reviews, alas yesterday, June 30, 2018, I found out that the CareSync Developers have been disbanded and the doors are closed.  Unless other developers pick up this app, I tend to believe that they will shut down their Data Server some time in the near future.  Is there a similar medical record keeping application that will Import the CareSync Data?

name: CareSync | Care Coordination
title: Just what I was looking for!
author: Bebkie
content: I highly recommend this app to everyone. It helps me keep track of all my familyâ€™s medical information. I added my doctors and medications and everything fell into place. I use it daily to log my symptoms, take medications, check for appointments and add my blood pressure. It helps me to keep organized. I love that I can add appointments and have them sync to my calendar. Itâ€™s not a perfect app, but itâ€™s the best I could find and believe me I have tried a lot of them.

name: CareSync | Care Coordination
title: Data disappears
author: MountainPark
content: App for both iPad and iPhone is unstable. The family members I have added, including the patient for whom I am caregiver, disappear. I have to turn off and then back on my device in order for family members to reappear. This has happened repeatedly in the first 12 hours of downloading this app.

name: CareSync | Care Coordination
title: Love the updates!
author: FLGirlTampa
content: I love the ability to track pain and overall well being. We try to do this to help the doctor see the patterns and because it is hard to remember. This along with the Timeline of my history that I can share with my doctor and the visit recording are my favorites things.

name: CareSync | Care Coordination
title: Very Frustrating!
author: Colorado Gramdmother
content: This app is exactly what I want to use, but the information I enter just disappears. For awhile it's there, but then it disappears. If I delete the app and reinstall, the info will be there for a day and then disappear again. No help when I called support.

name: CareSync | Care Coordination
title: Love - but update please.
author: leelpatt
content: I have been using this app for over a year now. I love all this app can do. It really helps me keep track of everything in one place. However, it could use some updates. I hope the developer hasn't dropped the ball on this one.

name: CareSync | Care Coordination
title: Poor excuse for a time saving health tracker
author: owndao
content: Spent 3 hours last night trying to get this obsolete app to exchange data with my diabetes health tracking app that supports Health Kit as do all the measurement apps I use. This one supports about 5 apps via some other, apparently little used protocol. I've examined two of those apps and find them as bad or worse than this. The communication is Internet connection dependent even between apps on the same device! As for communicating with my physician, I'm at the mercy of text-only communication. Strictly "stone knifes and bear skins", state of the art 1970. To the distributor, please update the app to support Apple's Health frameworks ASAP. This apps functionality would be more efficiently served by a paper labbook, a xerox machine and the US mail.

name: CareSync | Care Coordination
title: An inexpensive way to tackle rising healthcare costs
author: co18co
content: Each year, our healthcare expenses increase and we are forced to pay an increasing amount of attention to the healthcare we consume.  CareSync has helped me gather all of my family member's health records, and has made them useful to me- they are on my iPhone. I have recently shared up-to-date immunizations with my son's pediatrician, avoided duplicate (expensive) tests at the ER, and was able to share concise clinical updates with my primary care doctor.  Everybody is in the loop, my doctors treat me with respect, and I know the CareSync team is working on my behalf.  Highly recommend for anybody coordinating care for loved ones or managing chronic illness.

name: CareSync | Care Coordination
title: My doctor believed me!
author: BondGirlLisa
content: I have been going to the doctor for a long time for a chronic condition.  Every time I see a new specialist, I have to start over with my story.    I started using CareSync and took the information with me to the next visit. No more questions, no more eye-rolling, no more starting over with the same labs and treatments. She saw it in black & white (I faxed my records from the app) and said, "Oh, you really have had all this."  My visits are productive, I go less often, and I'm taking less medicine now that I'm communicating effectively.

name: CareSync | Care Coordination
title: So confusing, you'd think they did it on purpose
author: davidbressler
content: I can never quite find my prescriptions. Then, when I find them they show as not taken even though I know I hit "took" on the notification.  Turns out, even though they display Apple Watch notifications they don't support them (whatever that means). So basically the app doesn't work for prescription tracking.  Looks like they've taken a web app and dummies up an iPhone app. Find a company willing to write a real app instead of these guys.

name: CareSync | Care Coordination
title: Pure awesomeness
author: SoCalMJM
content: I am so happy that I have this app because it helps me care for my mom who has a few big health problems we are managing. If/when she goes to the doctor or even the hospital, I feel good knowing they can see records from her multiple doctors. We stopped repeating tests and our last hospital visit seemed shorter because of that. Also her records don't get archived after 3 or 7 years, they are here forever so her doctors will be able to see a full history for her.  I like that Either of us can log her meals, and wellness daily. It's quick and easy on an iPad or phone. It also will help her doctors see patterns and know what is and isn't working for her. This app gives me peace of mind knowing mom is getting the best complete healthcare. Finally. It is important for me to share my review because I think it has the potential to help a lot of other caregivers out there like me.

name: CareSync | Care Coordination
title: An amazing app
author: Shining_Iris
content: I absolutely love this app and the services offered by CareSync. As a patient and a mother I love that I have access to my health records and my family's all in one place.

name: CareSync | Care Coordination
title: Our solution to manage care coordination.
author: co18co
content: The CareSync app and services help me every single day. The CareSync team is available 24/7 to take my calls, and answer my messages.  They schedule doctorâ€™s appointments, and help me make sure the right information is delivered to the right people.  The app is easy to use, and I have amazing information with me at all times. And itâ€™s SO collaborative - everybody who needs to see my health information has access - but it still is secure. If youâ€™re managing a chronic illness, or taking care of a loved one, the money spent on their premium services pays for itself in less than a month!

name: CareSync | Care Coordination
title: Still lovin' it
author: Unbakednine
content: Amazing app, and great customer service makes me love this app and its creators.

name: CareSync | Care Coordination
title: THIS IS REMARKABLE
author: Njlady930
content: I am 28 a single mother of a 2&3yr old, I have Lyme disease fibromyalgia & A list of stomach issues  I love this app this is amazing  ITS FREE  HELPS KEEP TRACK OF YOUR LIFE  From tracking medicine, to pain, appts, and tons of other things you can even add your kids to help with them  THANK YOU SO MUCH !!

name: CareSync | Care Coordination
title: App was great till update
author: northwesternpat
content: Force closes with latest iPhone 6 iOS. Fail

name: CareSync | Care Coordination
title: Glad I didn't pay...
author: Diva Phoenix
content: Been using 2-3 weeks. Loved this app, yesterday I was prompted to update, now I can't log in from my device. Website login was also down. Contacted support and the guy only served to frustrate & insult my intelligence. He went around with me for about 20 minutes & told me that their site being the issue was impossible until I pointed out that an inability to access a login screen on THREE different platforms couldn't possibly be user error. Then he finally decided to ask someone & there was, in fact, an issue with the site. I eventually got into the website to write down the notes I needed for my appt. Still cannot access via the app on my iPhone... & now as a result, I also have a bunch of notes that I have to enter in - which COMPLETELY defeats the purpose of a "convenient" digital app.

name: CareSync | Care Coordination
title: No surprises
author: Abel's baby mama
content: It was really surprising to me to realize how uninvolved/uninformed I was about my healthcare, until I had an issue. After downloading CS and then getting all my records, I was shocked to see how much information I was unaware of. There were health issues that I would have followed closer if I would have known. Additionally, I feel much more informed and in control of my info...not like I'm at the mercy of my Dr's office or any others. I can be more active in my own healthcare management. Tons of data in the hands on a few docs, no collaborating, but now I can be the common factor, not just what they know about me, but my whole medical picture.

name: CareSync | Care Coordination
title: Great apps!
author: Grzhop4
content: Love this app and it meets my daily needs! ğŸ˜�

name: CareSync | Care Coordination
title: Finally
author: EpatientsUnite
content: Finally there is a solution for me to manage my own healthcare. Caresync has made it very easy for me to own my  health records so that I'm better prepared and educated for all of my doctors visits. Finally I'm in control instead of blindly relying on my doctors.

name: CareSync | Care Coordination
title: Highly recommend!
author: emmitc_PT
content: As both a consumer and provider of health care, I have found that having one's medical records so accessible to be truly beneficial. I have been able to provide all my new providers my health history with ease after my relocation. I had a photo of my insurance card handy in CareSync when I broke my foot in a race out of state and ended up in the ER.   I recommend CareSync to all my patients with chronic health conditions, those who are caretakers and anyone who wants to take an active role in their health care.  Healthy or sick, if you are a consumer of health care, CareSync is a must have app!

name: CareSync | Care Coordination
title: CareSync
author: Dragonfly Ribbon
content: I can't get my data all entered yet because it crashes every time I try! I suspect this will be a nice tool to use, but so far it won't stay open. PLEASE FIX!

name: CareSync | Care Coordination
title: Made my doctors visit matter
author: jenkd2
content: Caresync has made a huge difference during my doctors visits and I'm a relatively healthy person! Dr's spend more time with you and are genuinely excited about how engaged you are. And now I have a complete health record, which literally did not exist before. Will be recommending to all of my family.

name: CareSync | Care Coordination
title: Saved me money
author: tpazz313
content: My daughter had X-rays done on her arm at the emergency room and when we went to orthopedist, they wanted to do them again because they had not received them yet. Good thing I had them in my CareSync account. That was good enough for them.  No need to redo.

name: CareSync | Care Coordination
title: In control!
author: BP33!
content: As a father, I find it very reassuring that I now have my children's medical information with me when I take them to the doctor. I'm now armed with all the information to make every visit to the doctor a successful one because of Caresync. I seriously feel in control of my children's healthcare.

name: CareSync | Care Coordination
title: In control of my healthcare
author: wardamneagle_jwg
content: Finally an application that let's me get and manage all of my health information. CareSync Plus is simply amazing. Any doctor and any time I have all of my information. It's completely changed the way I interact with doctors and the care I get.

name: CareSync | Care Coordination
title: Super easy!
author: FLAFamily50
content: Can't believe how simple and easy getting my health records collected and made available to me this was. An incredible tool for helping me manage my own health records. Now I have my history in one safe place.

name: CareSync | Care Coordination
title: My health record with me anywhere!
author: VeraPoly17
content: I have CareSync plus and have my health records from my major providers in the app. I have a list of all medications I have ever taken right there with me and the appointment dates and notes. My favorite option in the all is Fax, I can fax my records to anyone at anytime from my phone. It has been so helpful to have this information on me at doc appointments, I feel a lot more involved when the doc talks to me.

name: MTBC PHR
title: My review
author: Jebarrng
content: The main problem is each time I login and attempt to pay the balance on my account. Its telling me to contact the office. All I want to do is clear my account of any monies I owe. Is that not one of the options. And I know that I have no scheduled appointments.

Although I have multiple appointments scheduled with my truly fabulous Doctor, the app shows I have no pending appointments.  It won't let me input my current meds for my doctor to know what my prescriptions are... What does this app do?  Like I said, it appears to do nothing at all.

name: MTBC PHR
title: MHTC
author: Mr. R, C
content: Maybe itâ€™s just operator error. Still trying to figure this out.

content: This app do not work at all

content: I donâ€™t know why I was given this

name: MTBC PHR
