author: Gram4two
content: This app stinks

name: MTBC PHR
title: If you like privacy, don't get this. And flowsðŸ˜±
author: Yokoâ€™s iPad
content: READ the terms and conditions! If you don't mind this company to distribute your information and whatever the third party wants to use the information for their benefit, this app might be for you. Otherwise, for the flows and the bugs still exist with this app, it is low grade app.

name: MTBC PHR
title: User
author: Donna Faull
content: I have tried REPEATEDLY to sign up for this app, but it won't let me! Tells me my "account #" is wrong, tells me ID or email is wrong, tells me my password is wrong, tells me "fail" after I hit sign up. SOOOOO frustration!!! Help! I think this app would be perfect for me IF I can get SIGNED UP!!!

name: MTBC PHR
title: One of the great apps in Apple Store
author: I.Mind
content: wowâ€¦. When i did login to this app i was amazed to see the interactive wheel of PHR. It's color combination and user interaction is gr8. I can rotate the dialer for some time and won't get bore. The design of this app is excellent. I can't login because i am not registered user but i can take the demo. I will keep this app in my iPhone :-) LOVE the Concept

name: bant - Simplifying diabetes
title: Great upgrade, modern look
author: LuchoM
content: Review update, Dec 6, 2016:  This new version looks great and it now works flawlessly with IOS10. It now syncs with the Apple Health app, instead of the Microsoft Health Vault; you can choose different times of testing, pre or post meal time. Great update.  As soon as I upgraded my iPhone 5S to IOS10, the syncing function with MS Health stopped working and gives an error message instead. This app needs updating.  Review update: June 26, 2017:  I am getting duplicate entries for every log. Why? The only difference is the occasion (post dinner v. post snack).  This seems to be a bug.

name: bant - Simplifying diabetes
title: Does not Sync with MS Healthvault
author: Bronx1949
content: After upgrading to iPhone v10 the Bant appt produces an error when and will not sync with MS Healthvault. MS Support says issue is with Bant. Bant Support does not appear to exist, at least they never respond to any queries on the issue. Bant responded to me and advised they will no longer support iPhone. So why is the app still available at the Apple Store to download.

name: bant - Simplifying diabetes
title: Useless
author: HellyJo
content: No instructions on how to use could not log numbers glad it was free even .99 would be to much also to write a review HAD to DO to MANY would not take nickname

name: bant - Simplifying diabetes
title: Almost fills the bill
author: DigitalDoug
content: Really like the basic functions of this app, does the data collection and tracking suffice for me. Quick and Easy.  However the main feature that attracted me in the first place, the ability to tweet,   For me, it's iffy at best. Some times it will tweet, most times it won't, and I have to copy/paste over to the Twitter app which had no problem.  Not perfect but, for free, it's OK.

name: bant - Simplifying diabetes
title: Tweeting
author: Josh Puckett
content: If you're going to advertise tweeting at least deliver. That is the only thing that sets this app apart.

name: bant - Simplifying diabetes
title: Keep working at it
author: T1_20yrs
content: Tracking BG without any ref (except time) isn't terribly useful, add spots for short/insulin, and meds would be very nice. Also, food intake would be great. I realize that there other apps that do this, but none (that I've found) which link to Google.

name: bant - Simplifying diabetes
title: I'll update when they fix this
author: smartblond
content: For some reason there is no room for those of us that don't work traditional hours. My day starts at 1pm. This app won't allow that

name: bant - Simplifying diabetes
title: Best free app for easy Type 2 monitoring
author: tyler_h
content: I was just diagnosed with Type II a few weeks ago, & I knew the best way to track my sugars (the way I would consistently do it, anyway) was with my iPhone. I tried several free apps & overall have been happiest with this one. I especially like the Google Health interface. My only request would be an option to manually input readings via some keypad/scroll wheel method like the other apps (perhaps this could be a user enables option?). I sometimes have trouble getting the slider exactly where I want it, & I just think a more straightforward input method might be convenient for some people. I had no problems setting up custom labels for all the different times of the day I check my levels. The Twitter feed is a nice addition to read what others are doing. Thank you to the developers for creating this free useful app.

name: bant - Simplifying diabetes
title: It's getting there...
author: eonshadow
content: Let me start with this statement. This app has potential. I absolutely love the fact the blood sugars are sent to my google health profile. My endo can see my blood sugars in near real-time!  Now let's get down to brass tax. The interface can be infuriating. I want to be able to graphically see where my blood sugars are, but not have to place them graphically. An option to add blood sugars with using the telephone layout keypad would provide a fast entry solution. I would like to be able to send my insulin intake to google health. please add support for this. additionally, i would like to be able to log my carb intake.  Granted, i know, there are many other apps out there that do things similar to what i am describing. I have used them and have only found one that does most of these. This app would be the best because of the google health integration!

name: bant - Simplifying diabetes
title: Awesome!
author: jpop825
content: I don't know what everyone else here is complaining about...   1. You can customize as many categories as you want, such as Pre-Lunch, Post-Lunch, Other, Fasting.  You can set as many of these as you want. 2. it is very easy to place the dot.  What you do is slide around until you find your number, then pause there for a few seconds and it will lock it in.  You DO NOT have to let go at just the right spot. If it is wrong (which seems rare for me) you can just touch it and move it again.  My only complaints are that (1) the X and Y axes of the graph are flipped compared to most blood sugar graphs.  From left to right you have the reading, and up and down is time of day. If there was an option to change that so that it could be shown either way this would be a 5 star app! (2) Daily/Weekly/monthly overlay (by time) graphs would be nice too. Lastly, (3) I'd like not only a % in range but a % above and % below.  Just more information.  FANTASTIC app overall.  Great job!  Keep up the great work!

name: bant - Simplifying diabetes
title: Pretty much useless
author: • Khai •
content: Too simplified, doesn't give you the option to enter random bg. And who would share their bg's on Twitter or store them at google health? There are many good apps to track your blood glucose levels so my advice is to skip this one...

name: bant - Simplifying diabetes
title: Simple to use - but most advanced
author: Ronski92
content: This is the only diabetes app (or any medical app for that matter), that stores your data to a real PHR - Google Health.  Great work!  Where's HealthVault though?  Like the new ability to set your own context to anything you want.  Love the twitter integration - all my diabetes friends are there!  I'm not sure what Daiysed is taking about below - unless he's using an old version.

name: bant - Simplifying diabetes
title: much to basic no settings
author: Daiysed
content: This looked like it was going to be a pretty good app I liked the graphics ....but I Keep a different schedule only imput is from 9.am. to 9 p.m. and you cant add Random or Fasting samples just B/L/D not ever gonna work for me very hard to get the time and Glucose levels input in the correct area Instructions would be helpful too!

name: bant - Simplifying diabetes
title: Skip this one
author: Dlimke
content: Nice that it's free, but very difficult to accurately drop the data marker in the right place. Also, you can only input data for meal times and I check at other times of the day, also. Nice that you can send data to Google Health account, thought. A couple of interface tweaks would vastly improve this app.

name: bant - Simplifying diabetes
title: Totally useless piece of junk...
author: the_vermonter
content: As a type 2 diabetic, I've already tried and discarded many diabetic log apps. This one is the worst of all. The interface is difficult to use and even worse to figure out. You cannot limit testing to just breakfast, lunch, dinner and bedtime. Entering readings is nearly impossible along with the time of day. No documentation means it is impossible to synchronize with Google Health. It may be free but that only means it aint worth nothing...

name: bant - Simplifying diabetes

content: This is an amazing App. Extremely well done graphics very intuitive and OMG I can share my results within my support group. AND its free. Thank you. Great job!!!

My primary Doctor loves the program as well as the nurses in the hospital. When they ask a medical question I have it right with me. I've ever given the phone to the nurse so she can get the needed information herself. Although it's pretty self explanatory and intuitive, its still very slow, a little confusing and a pain that keep updated. Another improvement would be some way of overriding the finger print ID. In case of an emergency it's nice going to do any given from anybody

name: RaceAddict
title: Great app!
author: Racer987216
content: This is a fantastic app for the price. It has lots of neat features, including the ability to display race location, mapping, and website within the app, as well as the handy ability to text or email all race details at the touch of a button. It also stores notes and expo information for each race. I love the unique graphical interface. A few suggestions for future updates:  1 add a checkbox within each record called "entry fee received." Races with this box checked display a different color in the future races list. It would also be nice to have the ability to sort future races by this status, i.e. "show only races with entry fee paid" checkbox.   2 add the ability to delete a record.   3 add the ability to print race details.   4 add the ability to search the notes or expo field.   Overall a great app for the price. Highly recommended.

Completed race, future races and a wish list.  Now I can keep it all in a handy app.  Just a couple ideas for future updates:  *Ability to add a picture for each race  *A 50 stater tab. It would list each state and then show you every race that you've done there.   *A wish list check box. So you can enter the race info and mark it as wish list. Once you pay the entry fee, then uncheck the box and it moves to future race tab. Or even that when the box is checked it highlighted a color, so you can easily see if a race is paid for or not.

content: This shows all upcoming races and all of the information! You can get directions from the app, you can access the website from the app, everything! Now I don't have to search through emails to find all of my information. This keeps PRs, expo notes, and everything else. I run races all the time and it's nice to have everything in one place instead of searching my inbox or my calendar. Highly recommend for the avid runner!

name: RaceAddict
title: Genius App!
author: BENE37
content: Finally a way to track all of your upcoming races at your finger tips! Never again will you have to go through old emails or papers to remember what races you want to register for or what time your next race starts.

name: MedXCom for Patients
title: MedXCom is an awesome app!!
author: docmjn
content: So easy to use. It is great that I can securely store my medical history and medications on this app. I love that i have my children's medical info/immunization records with me at all times.

name: MedXCom for Patients
title: Local
author: james_wick
content: It would be great if local physicians/doctors were listed through the app. It would serve as a form of advertisement for them, and make the app far more effective for me. If my doctors aren't using it, it is nearly useless. Great idea though.

name: MedXCom for Patients
title: Love having a virtual health "wallet"!
author: OneTimeHiker
content: I think it's great that I don't have to carry my insurance card around with me since i like a slim wallet.  It's a great place for me to store my immunizations so that I don't forget at the next doctor visit and love the medication reminder feature.

name: MedXCom for Patients
title: Awesome App!
author: Brett Kaplan
content: I can never remember when I last took medicine and this app easily tells me when it's time for my next dose!

name: MedXCom for Patients
title: MedX user
author: Jchen0583
content: Very easy to use and a great way to organize your information.

name: MedXCom for Patients
title: Physician asst
author: JWPA
content: Great app and easy to use!  I am recommending it to all my family and friends.

name: MedXCom for Patients
title: Awesome app
author: S Dalsania
content: So cool!

name: MedXCom for Patients
title: Consumer
author: Cmmag2012
content: I love that I can input, manage, and have access to my health information whenever I want and wherever I am  (especially when traveling). No more back and forth with the doctor's office just to see when I had my last tetanus shot. This is great!

name: WODTrackr
title: App not working
author: Hsalaman1
content: App isn’t opening up

name: WODTrackr
title: Please bring back the white board
author: SpongeWorthy10
content: Can you please bring back the white board feature?  It was nice to see the next day's WOD and see which athletes are working out.  Thanks

name: WODTrackr
title: Crashed
author: pjlarue
content: Love the fact that you can log all PRs for everything under the CrossFit sun, but the app only worked one day for me

name: WODTrackr
title: Two days and crashed
author: Houstonfenix
content: The interface was easy to use, and it had all of the workouts I wanted listed in the entry options. On the third day of use, the app wouldn't log in, leaving only a white screen that briefly flashed "invalid email" when I hit the home button. No way to fix it, retrieve info, or log out/log in. It ate my scores. Granted, it ate two days of scores so I'm not devastated, but I would have been if that had been months of scores. I'm going to look for something more reliable, and in the meantime just add scores into my Notes app.

name: Healee
title: Problem connecting to to Healee
author: chaosdharma
content: App does not open. OK. Zero performance = Zero stars. Delete App. OK.

name: Healee
title: Cool app
author: wbmp1288
content: This is a pretty cool app. I like how it gives me information on treatment for different issues because I am often trying to see of there is anything I can do store going to the doctor.

name: Healee
title: Really good for sharing health info
author: Levy99
content: Having my health history shared between my iPhone and iPad helps a lot. I also like the provided tips and drug information.

name: Healee
title: Nice app for managing your health
author: P.Crystal
content: Having all your past conditions, symptoms and the medicines you've taken, at hand, is really cool and helps a lot when I talk to my physician. The pill reminder also makes things easier when having a strict schedule to adhere to.

name: Healee
title: Excellent app!
author: Jeff Matthews
content: Makes tracking health information really easy. The provided information about conditions and medicines also helps a lot.

name: Healee
title: Easy to use and very informative
author: FredDHarper
content: I've used this app to check some symptoms and then I searched the suggested diseases for more information. This app is really easy to use and has a lot of info on many diseases.

name: Healee
title: Good for tracking conditions
author: R. Newbold
content: I've been using it mostly for tracking conditions and symptoms and it does a pretty good job

name: Healee
title: Like it
author: Lissa Rankin
content: Thanks for this app. Works like a charm and it helps a lot

name: Healee
title: Great tool
author: Andrew_68
content: I've just used it to organize some drugs which I'm about to start taking. Haven't tried the reminders yet. Really hope they work fine. Getting information about the drugs was a nice surprise.

name: Healee
title: Love the symptom checker
author: JenHoward733
content: No-brainer and easy to use. Add more reports, please!

name: Healee
title: Really useful app
author: Agirl13
content: I've been using it for a few months and I think it really helps. My past symptoms and the medicines I've taken are well organized and accessible at any time. The reports are nice too.

name: Medical Wiz Pro - Family Health Information
title: Uploading MR
author: tataylor1233
content: This app has no way to upload your medical records from either your healthcare provider or your insurance company which is what I was looking for.

name: Medical Wiz Pro - Family Health Information
title: I really want/need this to be a great app, but it’s not there, yet.
author: mrsbrick
content: I have tried at least a dozen different medical apps... This is one of the better ones, it is the start of a really great app, but it definitely needs some additional options. First, I would really like to upload some documents from doctors. Often when we see doctors we get A LOT of handouts about treatment plans, etc... I would really like to upload those to this medical app so everything is in one place. You also really need to have a way to track symptoms, like when my child is sick or running a fever, I’d like to track his temperature, when he has last vomited, etc... I would also like to be able to track height, weight, BP, pulse and even better would be peak flow measurements. Also, with the medicine, a way to track when medication is taken and due, etc.. Not just what we are regularly taking. Being able to see when we had the last dose of pain reliever or cough medicine would be amazing. PLEASE MAKE SOME IMPROVEMENTS SO I CAN FINALLY HAVE A MEDICAL APP THAT DOES WHAT I NEED IT TO DO.

name: Medical Wiz Pro - Family Health Information
title: Simple to use covers the basics
author: terry978
content: I needed a program that I could record medical information. This program is simple and straightforward, very easy to use. You don’t have to use a proprietary cloud to save your data. It saves/retrieves your data to either the iCloud or Dropbox which is great. It’s one disadvantage is that it is a bit inflexible. This is a very promising application that would be great with a few minor additions. The single item I would suggest to improve is adding the capability to add tests. I have had several lung, kidney, bone marrow and liver biopsies, but I cannot enter them because these aren’t in the fixed list. I am sure there are many other types of tests that aren’t listed. The graph function doesn’t work properly but this is minor. I would also suggest adding a section for date/time of an advanced directive as this is very important.

name: Medical Wiz Pro - Family Health Information
title: Updates
author: Blue Vylet
content: I love this app but I'm concerned about doing the new iOS update. It states all apps must update to work properly. Are you going to do an update to make it compatible. I would hate to loose all my data.

name: Medical Wiz Pro - Family Health Information
title: Works Great and easy to use
author: Thehalls24
content: Great and easy to use

name: Medical Wiz Pro - Family Health Information
title: Great
author: 007omar alqam
content: Great app

name: Medical Wiz Pro - Family Health Information
title: Excellent App
author: Not a Fan in AZ
content: Quick way to stay current.

name: Medical Wiz Pro - Family Health Information
title: Inert
author: App User 1000
content: Does not work

name: Medical Wiz Pro - Family Health Information
title: An all in one place Medical App!
author: Tranquilmoments
content: I love this app! I have a pretty extensive medical background. This app has helped me so much.

name: Medical Wiz Pro - Family Health Information
title: Great Little App
author: Gypsyjoy724
content: I had a hard time finding a medical record app. Seems this is an area app developers haven't found too profitable. This little app doesn't have all the bells and whistles, but does a great job a recording medications, supplements, vaccines, and medical test results. That was the primary need I had as moves has disconnected me from medical records.

name: Medical Wiz Pro - Family Health Information
title: Medical Wiz
author: Acheck
content: Has the information categories I need to keep my medical information with me and available at my appointments. I am able to share with my wife.  Keep up the support.

name: Medical Wiz Pro - Family Health Information
title: Doesn't deliver
author: Elle n M
content: Doesn't work as expected, passcode lock does not lock.

name: Medical Wiz Pro - Family Health Information
title: Limited use
author: bmccammon
content: I wanted to store my family's medical history in one place and bought the app because it said it has multiple profiles.  The app limits you male and female profiles...no ability to add multiple people that I can find.  No ability to add notes in places like "family history".  Entry options to this category are very limited.  This is not the app I hoped it would be.  Bummed about $3.00 for nothing useful.

name: iBlueButton®
title: Bloatware:  DO NOT BUY
author: fmanans
content: Frequent crashes, timeout errors on VA, Medicare, Tricare sites:  much faster going directly to the site(s) with i.d. password downloading via Blue Button option.  Lacks very important secure messaging feature required to communicate with providers regarding your medical record!

name: iBlueButton®
title: Keeps all the easily overlooked details in order
author: lo171
content: This app has been a massive help—my mother (who’s on Medicare) has been dealing with chronic health issues, which means lots of doctors and lots of medications. I live out of state, which makes it extremely difficult for me to keep track of what’s going on; iBlueButton keeps all of her doctors’ contact info in one place, should a crisis situation occur. Plus, it keeps all her meds listed in a format she can show to a new specialist, to make sure she’s not given anything that will react poorly with the meds she’s already on.  Having a sick parent is hard no matter what, but it’s much easier to deal with when you’re not having to prompt them for details they’d rather not think about.

name: iBlueButton®
title: Useful app for VA / TRICARE
author: CurtisCurtisSoAwesomexxxxppppp
content: I was active duty for 28 years and am now covered by the VA.  I found the app intuitive and was able to quickly get both my TRICARE and VA records, all aggregated in one place. Sweet.

name: iBlueButton®
title: Nurse approved
author: LesterzzzzooooLesterxxxx
content: As a nurse, I find this app incredibly useful. To have all of a patient’s medications in one place is a real lifesaver. I treat a lot of Medicare beneficiaries and I’ll be spreading the word about this.

name: iBlueButton®
title: Medicare record works great
author: RobertoxxxxooooppppRoberto
content: Recently became a Medicare beneficiary. Heard about this and tried it and got my Medicare record.  Working great so far!

name: iBlueButton®
title: Worthless
author: Microtechs
content: This app is worthless for personal medical history. It doesn’t store near enough information to make it worth $0.99 let alone a whopping $15.  You can’t add when you started or stopped medication. There’s no place for dates of anything. There’s really no place for previous surgeries, dates and notes about the procedures and outcome. You can download from just a few sources if by chance your physician happens to subscribe to the service.  Wasted my money. You’d be better off spending the money trying out 4 or 5 other apps that at least have fields to input data that you really need when you see a doctor or go to a hospital and they need your medical history when your in severe pain or have to remember years back.

name: iBlueButton®
title: Works great; always getting updates
author: YormaK
content: We use this app all the time to manage our entire family's medical records.  Works great!  And it's nice to see the commitment from the developer to always keep improving and updating this app.

name: iBlueButton®
title: Not worth it
author: Humando
content: I can't even get it to download from one of the four EMR platforms for which it was designed. I want my money back.

name: iBlueButton®
title: Awesome app
author: YouSnoozeYouLoose
content: This app is absolutely fantastic and definitely the best out there.

name: iBlueButton®
title: Essentially Abandonware
author: August23rd
content: the last update as of this post was at the end of may of last year, frequently crashes, I regret ever paying for the app, it DOES NOT connect with Apple Healthkit as a data source... (you'd think you could/should but it doesn't).   Worthless app. You'd think at 15 bucks they'd actually hire a developer to maintain the app but nope.

name: iBlueButton®
title: Crashy, user-hostile garbage
author: Kirkkerekes
content: This app is terrible -- it crashes all the time, and is pretty much impossible to use because of brain-dead design decisions.

name: iBlueButton®
title: The Worst App EVER
author: In92101
content: I have tried twice to make this app do what it says it will do, without any success. Can't even set up a profile that doesn't immediately disappear. Interface is not the least bit intuitive. I question whether any of the 5-star reviews are by real people not affiliated with the developer. I have downloaded hundreds of apps and used them successfully. I've never paid more for an app than what I paid for this. Totally disappointed. Please save your money.

name: iBlueButton®
title: Beware: Doesnt sync with any insurance or doctors offices
author: FourteenthCenturyGirl
content: Great concept but Very limited network. Mainly for vets. Syncs with 5 things: VA, aetna, medicare. No hospital networks or insurance like BCBS. Cant see how to enter results manually. I want my money back.

name: iBlueButton®
title: Tracking My Medical History
author: HealthFir$t1!1!
content: I'm very happy that this app has allowed me to carry my records in my phone. it is very easy to go to a new doctor and speak about my conditions and have my current medications handy. with the updates that I keep downloading I am pleased that this app will continue to be worked and not neglected.

name: iBlueButton®
title: Application crashes with last iOS update
author: lochavendrr
content: Application opens and accepts my IT touch but when I touch my name to open my records the application crashes. I've rebooted my phone and it still crashes.  18 Nov 2015 update - still can't get my updates to my medicare records since iOS 9 update

name: iBlueButton®
title: Very pleased
author: Lngwy
content: Could not be happier with this app. I'm so pleased that there is a convenient way for me to carry my healthcare records with me to every doctor's appointment. As a Medicare patient, this app is a lifesaver.

name: iBlueButton®
title: Used to work
author: Tatted-Pierced-Beauty
content: No longer works crashes every time. Sad excuse for an app

name: iBlueButton®
title: not worth it
author: cplavin
content: garbage!! will stay stuck on "authorizing"

name: iBlueButton®
title: Great app
author: Michele1020
content: As a caregiver this is an great app to keep track of my elderly mom's health info!

name: iBlueButton®
title: WORST
author: GrampyVet
content: This app should be pulled by Apple as it has is only a benefit for the developer to rip off veterans. Never completes any download tried. I tried on my IPhone 6 and my iPad 2 with same results. Better to donate the overpriced app money to help vets.

name: iBlueButton®
title: iBlue Button
author: salzach
content: Waste of $$$,wish I had not bought it.  Can not use it. Can I get my $$ back?

name: iBlueButton®
title: This app is important
author: CGHTB
content: I have my information on it for easy access aa well as my husbands, for whom I am primary caretaker. This saves me carrying multiple files and can answer just about any questions that come up.  The more physicians and hospitals become familiar with this it can be accessed by first responders and emergency personnel

name: iBlueButton®
title: A real winner
author: WendySueU
content: Super useful; full medical details and records.  All with me, everywhere I go.  And I can create and manage the care of my elder dad and two young boys. Bravo!

name: iBlueButton®
title: Such a great app!!!
author: Nbp678
content: I'm so thankful to have found this app. I use it for my elderly parents and it lets me use their Medicare Blue Button records every time they see their doctors. This app is a lifesaver!

name: iBlueButton®
title: Healthcare fraud?
author: HeavySleeper
content: Total POS for $9.99  Deceptive---does an exceptionally poor job of capturing or storing your health data.  Useless---iBlueButton does not connect to your clinical data with Probability = 0.9 or higher. A 2nd lie.  Humetrix has pulled the wool over another patient's eyes. Shame on Humetrix.

name: iBlueButton®
title: Very Disappointing & Misleading Features
author: TPalm002
content: Not Worth Purchasing - For the price and the noted awards/recommendations. I was expecting a well thought out application incorporating EMR non-EMR physician records.  Unfortunately the user ‘input’ interface is impossible to use.  Example), The immunization list is extremely limited.  Typical travel immunizations (typhoid, Yellow Fever, Rabies etc) are not listed nor can you manually add them.  For older folks the MMR may be broken out into two immunizations but there is no place to add this kind of info OR comments on the type of serum used or dates that boosters or TB tests were taken Example 2)  There is no place to manually put lab/tests or results.  These are very basic things that are easily transferable from a manual RMR into an EMR language.  I really would like my money back on this.

name: iBlueButton®
title: Mr
author: Gold 44
content: After calling Humetrix they said they would look into the problem of not being able to connect to the VA. They called me back and said there was a problem on their end and now it is fixed. Now it works just fine. Great customer service.

name: iBlueButton®
title: Awesome app!!!
author: Travis09876
content: So happy I found this app. The summary record is a great feature

name: iBlueButton®
title: Groundbreaking app!!!
author: lotsofls
content: I love this app!! The idea is extremely innovative and promising of the things to come!

name: iBlueButton®
title: User friendly, Very Useful App
author: JHA123
content: Great app, easy to use, understandable interface. I downloaded this app on my grandfathers iPad and he easily learned how to download and access his Medicare Blue Button records. The app also helped to inform my mother (his caregiver) of his conditions, medications, and other important information.

name: iBlueButton®
title: Does not work
author: VDDJ1972
content: This app does not work for veterans connected to their VA accounts.

name: iBlueButton®
title: Very useful app
author: Nikki P23
content: Love the summary record feature!!! Very smart

name: iBlueButton®
title: Great app
author: ShawnaB16
content: Very useful app. I love the fact that you can view and download your health record on your phone

name: iBlueButton®
title: Easy way to get medical records
author: DataDoc2012
content: The iBlueButton app gives you quick and secure access to your private medical information maintained by your medical insurance company or by Medicare. When you see your doctor, you can use this app to connect with their iPad and push the information to them.   Having this app means I never have to see a doctor again without having key medical information about myself available and ready to review!

name: iBlueButton®
title: Fantastic medical record app
author: Ramoramarami
content: Very well-designed medical record app. It lets you download your medical information in text and CCD formats from your multiple doctors. It links from your medications or your procedures to reliable information on the web. It lets you securely send your medical information to a new doctor, if you're traveling. You can create a record for each member of your family, even your dog. The advanced standards behind this app will allow it to communicate with other apps, Like a health risk assessment. I like it. It helps me better manage my health. Stay well!!

name: iBlueButton®
title: Very useful!
author: Forrest_112
content: Super convenient and well engineered, definitely worthwhile.

name: iBlueButton®
title: Not useable (iOS 7 issue?)
author: jfwj1234moe
content: Like another reviewer, the screen for entering security questions (answers) does not work, so I can't even get into the app to use it. I am running IOS 7. Hugely disappointed!

name: iBlueButton®
title: Mr.
author: wizkid67
content: I didn't know there was a way I could keep track of my medications and diagnosis on my phone until I found this app. I really like how easy it is to read my Medicare record - This app has the potential to save lives

name: iBlueButton®
title: DESIGN IS WORTHLESS
author: Racketo
content: I can't even put in answers for the security questions.   It's not obvious if the answer has been entered.   The last two questions can't be read in their entirety.   "What was the name if your hig..."  "Where did you meet..."  NO idea what is being asked.   Please go back to app school:  BASIC DESIGN 101

name: iBlueButton®
title: Not Super Impressed
author: ErsatzRubric
content: As someone who just has normal insurance coverage through Aetna, this app doesn't do much for me. It allows me to basically download a multi-page PDF from my insurance company and push it to a doctor. Helpful for vacations I suppose but it would be a lot more useful if the data was downloaded into a more interactive app that I could add more information too. Also it only lets me download info about myself versus my whole family.

name: iBlueButton®
title: Health Records Without Paperwork
author: sandnsrf
content: Now I can get my health records wherever I am. This is great! No more paperwork. It simplifies my life.

name: iBlueButton®
title: Great mobile-health app
author: Yorma
content: I follow mobile-health initiatives and am familiar with the Blue-Button initiative for putting patients in control of their health information.  This is a fantastic tool that does just that!  It's perfect for Medicare patients.  I'm going to tell my parents about it.

name: I'M HOME! ®
title: Like no other!
author: Z. Petrovich
content: I’m Home app let me stay updated with my doctor and track recovery after a recent back injury and surgery.  Also gave me good tips for not causing damage again and gaining strength.

name: I'M HOME! ®
title: Impressive tools, very helpful
author: AGibbs19
content: Just downloaded it a few days ago and I love it so far. I'm using it to keep track of all of my "homework" after getting out of the hospital. Talking with my nurse is easy and quick too.

name: I'M HOME! ®
title: App explorer
author: Young the translator
content: Fantastic app.  I can totally use it for taking care of me and my dad

name: I'M HOME! ®
title: I'm Home is a blessing
author: ShaniquaJackson
content: I'm now able to monitor my father's diabetes more effectively.

name: Dyrii Journal
title: Refund
author: EliteSparkZz
content: Hello. I just purchased this app by accident. I didn’t know it costed 10 dollars. Can I get a refund?

name: Dyrii Journal
title: Best journaling app for iCloud
author: Zendevote
content: Nice journaling app that keeps all my data on my iCloud. I also love using its Apple Pencil feature on iPad.

name: Dyrii Journal
title: Lots to learn
author: witzed
content: Documentation is very poor. How can something this simple be so badly explained...

name: Dyrii Journal
title: Decent...but be aware
author: tacgroup2
content: As far as journaling apps go, this is definitely a nice one! Primarily because its one of the few that has pen support and, for those of us who like to take advantage of the benefits of actually writing instead of typing, this is an awesome feature! It has several other nice features like logging location, photo and video adding, tags, etc. All pretty standard stuff we’d expect in 2018 from an electronic journaling app, right?  Here’s the rub... I’ve been using the app daily for 2 weeks now. I’ve been successful at journaling without any issues maybe 50% of those days. The app frequently does odd things like not saving your entry or, after saving and then trying to edit your post and add to it, not saving any of the additional writing, which may be several pages worth! I’ve accidentally hit the new page arrow at the bottom with my palm, even though I have the palm rejection icon off, and then when I hit delete to delete the new page it deletes my whole entry. Maybe a dumb decision on my part but it would’ve been good to know that deleting an unwanted page also deletes all of your work to that point. When I first started using the app I couldn’t add photos. Now I can add photos but the experience is a bit janky and there’s no easy way to move the photos around in your post without ultimately screwing up your post and be careful...this is when you’re most likely tp delete your whole post...again!!!  I’ve submitted help requests a couple times and have received some response, thank you for that, but have received no responses after several days on my deleted posts issue. I can see the whole post in the timeline on the left but when I click on it to open it and edit it, there is only a half page of writing...out of 3 pages!! Very disappointing.   Oh well, onward and upward I guess. I’ve moved my journaling back to OneNote again as I am a tad more confident in that piece of software.  Maybe one day, if they can make Dyrii a little more user friendly, reliable, and stable, I’ll be back. Until then...

name: Dyrii Journal
title: Beautiful writing solution
author: Photo_op
content: Finally! A full throated journaling app. However, calling it JUST a journaling app does it an injustice. It does so many things WELL, that I may be able to shelve as many as 50% of the apps I have on my iPad. AMAZING and thank you!

name: Dyrii Journal
title: Best Journal App out there
author: SDfromSD
content: I have been using this App for about 1 month and love it! I like the daily quotes, I like the photo sync, and really like the simplicity of navigation. I came over from Day One classic and did not upgrade to their recent version. I hope this App sticks around a very long time. Thank you to the developer(s)!

name: Dyrii Journal
title: Too much friction - not for me
author: Bill.who
content: Like so many others, I’ve been looking for a Day One Classic replacement.  There are a lot of things that I would like to see in such an app, but the first thing I want in a journal is the ability to easily write (or otherwise create) an entry. Dyrii doesn’t do that.  Compare creating an entry on Classic to creating an entry with  Dyrii.  Day One classic.  Open the app. Press + Write entry (your first line is your title, which can be changed)  Dyrii Open the app Press + Select from a screenful of icons representing, I think, a mixed bunch of entry methods and tags Start writing (note that there is a separate title field)  Of you want to add a photo to a written entry, Classic: tap on the camera symbol at the bottom of the entry. Dyrii: ?, tho’ you can insert from the menu on the desktop version.   The extra steps are not terrible, but they create enough friction that I’m less likely to use it regularly. For people who sit down once a day to write, the features that this app offers might be compelling, but for me those features are meaningless because I won’t have enough entries to make them worthwhile.   A less important, but equally personal criticism: I really dislike the icon. The color seems muddy and the design is busy.   Sadly, deleting.

name: Dyrii Journal
title: Why only show the best reviews?
author: The Last Shott
content: At the time of this writing, there are 17 reviews. However only 12 are readable. Any review 3 stars or below are not readable. That along makes me not trust you with my personal daily information. I always like to read a few 1-3 star reviews to see if that person has a reasonable compliant. Helps me decide if I should spend $39.99 for a lifetime purchase with your company.

name: Dyrii Journal
title: Hands down the best journal app
author: Prettyby7
content: I used Day One before it added encryption back in 2014; I had been devoted to MacJournal since and had to look for an alternative because MacJournal for iPad does not seem to work well syncing across platforms. I also tried Journey before Dyrii but ran into immediate road blocks because it only supports import from Day One. I was able to import into Dyrii flawlessly with years of journaling intact. In addition, I am able to use Dyrii on iPad, iPhone and Mac effortlessly! I am simply in love with Dyrii since it works syncing across platforms, easy portability from other journaling apps, geolocation, tagging, and Audio notes – all features that make this a powerful journaling app. I post way more with Dyrii! Thanks for creating such an awesome and superior product, I couldn’t wait to buy the Premium version!

name: Dyrii Journal
title: Most Underrated App Ever
author: Skits164
content: I really like this app. If I wasn’t looking for an app that I could use on my Mac and my phone, I would of missed it due to the plethora of apps on the iPhone and the fact that there aren’t that many reviews for this one.  This app is password protected, it has unlimited entries, sketching, add afterthoughts on entries, audio, pictures, mood tracker and it is all for free. No tricks or gimmicks. Automatic sync costs a subscription but if you chose to upload both on the iCloud it will sync for free also.   The UI Is simple, easy to navigate and start using. You just click on the + and you can enter a new entry and you can do multiple entries a day. If you want to click into a previous one, it shows the preview. It’s not cluttered, buggy, and it hasn’t crashed on me once. Every time I open the app after going out of it, it opens with a password. Which is perfect. I’m just really happy I came across it and gave it a chance. It is by far better than DayOne or anything else I’ve tried.   I wish it had an option to create different journals besides the one on the timeline. I would definitely pay the annual subscription if there was an option to create new journals and write entries in there.

name: Dyrii Journal
title: Feature rich app
author: LiaVoid
content: Dyrii has almost everything you could wish for in a journaling app. I was a former Day One user until the lack of sketching(feel a need to sketch out my dream when I wake up and struggle to find words) and iCloud sync started to bug me. And of course the 10 photos limit and the lack of video support. Importing my Day One entries is seamless and “Perspectives” is a nice feature. Multiple journals would be nice and I saw a few bugs here and there but I hope the developers will work out soon. Overall I am satisfied with the app and the subscription.

name: Dyrii Journal
title: Suits my needs perfectly
author: 4mrMarineOfcr
content: I’ve been using the free versions of both the mobile and desktop Dyrii for about two months. Using the journals is straight-forward and easy to navigate. Being retired, my journal needs are rather simple. Just document discussions with medical consultants, travel agents, remodeling contractors, etc. and then be able to refer back to those entries at a later date. My Dyrii journals serve that purpose perfectly.

name: Dyrii Journal
title: Amazing Application
author: BigMcGuire55
content: Finally some real Day One competition! The developer is one of a kind - actually listens to their customers and implements what they want in under a week. I imported 1200 Day One entries and 1300+ photos. 780MB of MY data in iCloud. I love it. I'm a proud premium member. Thanks!

name: Dyrii Journal
title: Great app, responsive developers, and iCloud Sync
author: moklok
content: After my previous journaling app stopped supporting iCloud Sync, I didn't have high hopes of finding a replacement. Happy to say that Dyrii has exceeded my expectations. Not only do they support syncing entries through iCloud rather than forcing you to store sensitive data on their servers, but the app itself is great! Modern design, responsive, and lots of thoughtful touches that I haven't seen in other journaling apps yet. When I had a suggestion for a new feature, the developers engaged right away and have been working to implement it in the next version. I cannot recommend Dyrii highly enough!

name: Dyrii Journal
title: Love the concept!
author: Djedwards007
content: Great start!  Looking forward to video entries longer than one minute please.  Excited to see how this app matures!

name: Dyrii Journal
title: Amazing app
author: Lijo.geca
content: Growing up, I read somewhere people who keep journal live twice. That got me into journaling but I lost the habit when I became a teenager as I started to worry that someone might read my personal thoughts. Dyrii app has changed my notion. I am back to my habit of writing my entries and moreover it is easier to manage as it is all digital. I can secure it with a passcode and all my posts stay in my iCloud account and not on some unknown server. I can post pictures that only I can see. I can also securely share my posts selectively as PDF exports. The app also lets me record audio, video entires, and do sketches and doodles which I couldn't do before in a journal. My favorite feature is the search and perspective view that lets me instantly find my old entries. I absolutely love this app - 5 stars!

name: Dyrii Journal
title: The Best Journal App on App Store!!!!
author: J rico
content: I have searched through many journal apps and this is better than all others.  It's better than Day One, better than MacJournal, everything!  From integrated timelines which include milestones, and health updates, to entries which can use video, audio, photos, and drawings...  To being able to tag themes and add emotions, and rate locations you check into, this app has it all!  As a self-quantifier this is the best app i've come across thus far!!!

content: Why can't I login on the BCM app using my VALID username and/or password?! Please fix this! I've had the app since 2015 and never been able to use it.
